description:
Our London friends had limited time so we needed a quick lunch. Trying to find quick parking AND a reasonable restaurant can be a challenge, but we fortunately stumbled upon Pescatore near Fisherman's Wharf.  We were in a hurry, so I didn't bother to check the Yelp ratings and we took our chances - glad we did!  

Lunch was very good.  Our party of 4 had to of the chicken pannini's (not really pannini's, but delicious looking sandwiches on delicious focaccia bread and 2 Eggs Benedicts (one regular and one w/ crab cakes).  I loved the regular and my husband said the crab bene was "good".

The service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable for SF. I would definitely go back.
author: Jerolyn D.

description:
I'm being fair here giving this place 2 stars. The slight case if food poisoning it gave my wife and i warrants a 1 to zero stars. Service was lousy and they got my wife's drink order wrong and my dinner order wrong. Surprised this place remains open. I'd imagine rents high. Pizza's were good but who knows how they prepared it as my family was up sick all night following this meal. 

Asked for chicken parm with side of pasta with garlic and oil. I got chicken cutlet with no sauce at all and when I asked for a side of sauce it was 20 min later and it just looked nasty. I don't know if the food was clean or not. Either way, I'm going to resist putting anymore info out there on these guys. I wouldn't recommend this place and i was disappointed in my experience there.
author: Carmine S.

description:
Service leaves something to be desired. We went late lunch on a weekend and it seems they had 1 waiter. The entire process was slow and to make matters worse the last dishes to come out were the children (simple Mac n cheese). 

The food was ok, probably a little better than ok, but the service ruined the experience.
author: Allan R.

description: I liked the food and had a enjoyable time here. The food was a different Italian than I'm use to but good. I'm not Italian but I know what I like. But I do not understand why yelp only gives them 2$ signs. It's expensive! Maybe because everywhere we ate at in fishermen wharf area was.
author: Robert H.

description:
Great service. All the staff was super friendly and attentive. The food is okay. I may be a little bias as I have had authentic Italian food in Italy but none-the-less it wasn't great and it wasn't horrible, it was just okay. Desert was fabulous.

Good atmosphere, good location & nice staff.
author: Odett C.

description: I had the meatballs, which seemed to be quite undercooked. Didn't eat them, because they didn't taste right and I didn't want to risk getting sick. Took quite a while to get drink refills or waitresses attention as well
author: Marie D.

description: Pescatore is a quality restaurant with great food and service located in the Fisherman's Wharf area. It was recommended by my good longtime friend Lita Tulloch. I love tomato base pasta and they have the best spaghetti bolognese and white creamy shrimp pasta. The service is so important to me and service here is impeccable! They have great drinks and so conveniently located in the heart of the city ! I'll definitely be back !
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description:
I ordered Rissoto al granchio)(rissoto with Dungeness crab) . It's very small portion. It's over price. Lot's of crab shelves inside. And I found a fruit flies/baby flies inside.  No more!!!
Service is not friendly too
author: Julie M.

description: Went here for a quick bite to eat and a drink. We took advantage of the happy hour specials. We didn't realize you had to be sitting at the bar to get the specials so we moved to sit up there. I wish the happy hour chalk board sign said "bar only" or something. The wine was good and the oysters and calamari is solid. I gave 4 stars because I wish the staff had been friendlier. I just felt like I was bothering them.
author: Debbie G.

description: We came here for breakfast, so my review is solely based on breakfast. My first complaint are the chairs... they are cute, and stylish to look at but are so uncomfortable! If you're a larger man, or a curvy lady like our table... you won't be comfortable. The circulation to my legs were cut off, and I couldn't wait to het up. Service was okay.. everyone was nice, but had to wait a while for our check. Seems like it was understaffed. At first, when we ordered.. the server was hesitant about making a simple modification to one of the dishes, and said it couldn't be done. Then he brought the dish out with the modification made, so not sure what that was about. Maybe because it would have taken him longer/understaffing. I will say the breakfast was decent... they made everything the way we asked. My last complaint was the fruit. There should be no excuse for pre sliced fruit...Strawberries were not freshly sliced, they were wet, and soaked in sugar water.  cantaloupe, and honeydew were at least 2 days old. Fresh fruit, same day is so important. Overall 3 stars is the best I can do. I would definitely check out the other options in the area for breakfast. There are so many.
author: Roget M.

description:
Just reviewing the bar offerings, which I felt were expensive and marginal. I'm referring to the pizza; the SMALL pizza was 14.5 and very basic in quality and taste. 

The bartender Eddie is a nice guy, but this place is probably best left for the tourists who are staying in the adjoining hotel.
author: Sheila K.

description:
Close to the turistic area of fisherman warth its fun to find a true resturant and not a turist trap ;]
This is a great italian resturant, the atmosphere and the service was great. Our food came very fast and done to perfection.
The breakfast / brunch menue is on until late during the weekend which is great for those of us that wake up late on a vacation. (Moey places stop serving breakfast on SF at 11:30).
Also i noticed that they have a good bar selection if you like scotch.
I must give a special attention to the fresh jucises they have and the pasta (i had the one with all the musseles ) the pasta is done to perfection!
author: Evgene L.

description: Great food. Our server, Marlo was the best. Efficient and entertaining. We'll be back!
author: Tina P.

description:
We came in on a whim during mid day and the joint wasn't busy at all.  Host told us we needed a reservation...as we gazed around the 60% empty restaurant in confusion, we decided to just sit at the bar.

Bad choice.  The bar tender was a total jerk.  I ordered a wine but my friend wanted iced tea and he was annoyed from there on out.  Took forever to take our food order as he purposely ignored us trying to get his attention for 20 minutes.  We ordered and despite everyone else getting complimentary bread with their food order...we did not.

Food was good but not great.  Fries were like McDonalds quality.

I ordered a second wine and the server remained aloof.  Filled it and walked away.  I get everyone has bad days but put forth a freaking effort if you're in the service industry.  Geez.
author: Lyndsay V.

description:
This place is rated amazingly low for how good it is. Great location, good food and service, not a high priced/low quality tourist trap like some of the higher rates places on yelp nearby. 
Our kids loved the pasta, the marinara sauce was among the best we had. The salmon panini and veggie panini's were great. Will visit again next time we are in the area
author: Food C.

description:
Really good food and extensive drink menu. The staff here is friendly and attentive. We ordered pizzas, soft bread and sooooo delicious. No complaints, if you want to have dinner somewhere casual with a nice ambiance you should definitely stop by.  Cleanliness is super important to us and they definitely were. 

Marlowe was our waiter, nice, funny, outgoing. Thank you we'll stop by again.
author: Marie P.

description:
Our office team celebrated our holiday dinner at Pescatore.  This was my first visit to Pescatori and the food and service were fabulous. I particularly enjoyed my entrée which was the chicken parmesan.
We tried four different appetizers and my personal favorite was the fried calamari. 
We had a terrific service from our server Mary and the manager, Ruben, stopped by our table several times to make sure that we were pleased with the dinner.
Can't wait to come back and have another dinner at Pescatore!
author: Steven D.

description: Bad service, flavourless food, servers standing around evergreen doing nothing. The only reason it for two stars it was because it was clean and had a full bar. I would not recommend this place to anyone. The fact no one was here in the morning on a Sunday should have been our clue.
author: Tiffanie H.

description:
Ok, I need to start at the beginning. We wandered around Fisherman's wharf and it was a madhouse so we opted to just go back to the Hotel Zoe and eat at its commingled restaurant, Pescatore's, a   supposedly $$ value-wise. After perusing the menu though, most dishes of any consequence were $26-39.  In my book, really that's $$$, especially for pasta. 

So as a test, we opted for a Ceasar and an appetizer, the seafood antipasti.  The Ceasar was great, complete with generous anchovies and a perfect Ceasar dressing. The seafood Antipasti however was applaudable in presentation but  laughable in content. 2 tiny shrimp, 1/2 doz quarter-sized clams and 4 mussels and 2 lemon slices!  In all honesty, this wasn't an appetizer, it was a "shell game" as that's all there was for $16.50. But there's a bit more;

We ordered a couple dirty Grey Goose Martini's and truthfully, knew we'd pay a bit more. But to our surprise, out came a 1.5 oz mini martini sampler- glass with two large olives, at $14 bucks a throw. 

Bottom line is, this place boasts upper class but with a chintzy twist. And what's worse than that?
author: Ed K.

description: Always a pleasant and wonderful experience! Thank you George, Jamie, Rene and Frankie! Always look forward to seeing you and having a wonderful meal!
author: Kristine B.

description:
Four stars (rather than five) ONLY because this restaurant trends toward the spendy side--for me, anyway, if not for SF in general.

The food was so good, the first night, that we ended up eating there the next two nights, as well...and we were in SF for only those three nights!

Service ranged from acceptable to excellent (a different waiter on each night), portions were appropriate, and (my favorite part) I didn't leave feeling like I'd consumed a week's supply of salt, as is so often the case when dining out.

I'd definitely eat at Pescatore again, next time I'm in SF.
author: David B.

description:
Went with 3 of my coworkers for lunch, we all agreed that the experience was 1 or 2 star worthy. 

Pros: nice, quiet ambiance. 

Cons: the server got a couple orders/specifications wrong (salad instead of fries, got fries. Small Apple salad, got small plain salad). Room temperature water. My seafood linguine had sand in 3 of the oysters. The tomato chunks tasted like they were from the can. 2 of my coworkers ordered panini's which were just sandwiches with too much bread. Oh, and it was $130 for 4 people before tax.
author: Leeyen R.

description: Sat down for breakfast, got our juice and coffee and then ordered food that would never come.  Waiter never even came back to refill coffees.  We waited for 20 minutes and then just left.  Waiter never gave us the opportunity to tell him we were leaving.  Don't eat here.
author: Joel F.

description: Stayed at Hotel Zoe during our trip to SF and went to this restaurant multiple times. Breakfast and dinner were incredible. Lunch was just okay but the rest of our experience there made up for that. Our favorite part was the staff! We felt right at home in a city we'd never spent time in and looked forward to going back everyday to see them! I'd also recommend checking out their dessert menu and pairing it with their recommended dessert wine. Overall, this restaurant (and this hotel) is one of the top reasons we can't wait to go back to San Francisco!
author: AnnMarie J.

description:
They advertise that dining in Pescatore is a unique San Francisco dining experience and I guessing it must be, because we found it so European like that we ate there three times on our last visit, one lunch and two dinners.

And you know, I'm betting everything they have is good, but we wouldn't know, cuz I had the same thing all three times and Vesta did too. And that's because we both liked what we got the first time so much, that we kept ordering it. And I'm guessing the next time we're in San Francisco, and we go there a lot, we'll be dining there again.

I may not have tried everything on the menu, but I asked others if they like what they were eating and to a person they all said they loved it.

As for me, I had the spaghetti with two giant meat balls and Vesta had a three cheesy pizza she loved and cuz she couldn't finish, I got a slice of it all three times. So good it was.

Pescatore, if you wanna feel like your dining in Italy, you should dine there.
author: Ken D.

description:
Came up from Santa Rosa and found his hidden gem!
Started off with the seafood antipasti- AMAZING!!

Then went for the chicken Parmesan Alfredo dish and the flavors, OH THE FLAVORS!! You can tell the pasta is of excellent quality. Over all very enjoyable and very delicious

Def my fav new spot at the wharf and will be bringing my gf here to experience the great atmosphere and superb service. 

Irone the bartender knew exactly what to recommend for a hungry first timer and he has not steered me wrong so far. 2 thumbs up!
author: Shaun S.

description: Just perfect tonight. Our server, Marlowe, was awesome, timing was impeccable, food was great. We are from Chicago, staying near Pescatore and wanted something close and easy but off the tourist strip and this was it. We have two tweens and this was perfect for them. Kids menu and placemat with crayons to keep them busy. Perfect for what we needed.
author: Lorrie I.

description:
I ate here twice during my stay at Hotel Zoe. The first time I dined, I made reservations months in advance. I didn't need reservations because when I walked in around 7:30 a.m., there was only a few tables occupied. This was Black Friday. I told the person who walked up the front that I made a reservation. I didn't see him check me in on Open Table, so, of course, I always get worried.  I really dislike when people don't actually look at the reservation when someone went out of their way to make one.  Perhaps maybe they made notes under the reservation that are important such as a birthday or food allergies. I gave him the benefit of the doubt that he checked me in afterwards. 

I ordered the crab benedict both times.  The first time I ordered it with coffee, but the second time I didn't since I realized the hotel offered free coffee in the lobby. 

After the first time I dined, Pescatore marked me as a "no show" on Open Table, which I get dinged for. We use Open Table so we can get points and redeem them in the future.  I contacted Open Table and told them what I ordered and the name of the credit card holder that it was under, but they wanted me to show a receipt. I told them I didn't keep it, so I had to ask my friend to look under his online bank statement to take a screenshot of it to get my points. A lot of work just to get the points if the restaurant had just marked me as checked in.

The second time I came down, I made it a point to tell the person at the front to check me in because they didn't mark me in last time. He said, "Sometimes this happens."  But it doesn't have to happen. He said he didn't know how to work the Open Table, so he had to call someone else over to check me in. 

Other than that, the servers were friendly.  The eggs benedict were better at Hollywood Cafe and cheaper down the street, but this one doesn't have a wait so it's more convenient for hotel guests. Overall I enjoyed the quiet atmosphere in the morning.
author: Captain C.

description: Just had a delicious meal and great service from George at Pescatore.  The Caesar salad was fresh and the cheese tasty.  My main course was clams and pasta which I really enjoyed.  The clams were a little small, but the pasta was delicious with a generous amount of cheese grated over the top.  Yum!  And George was very attentive and kind.  I certainly want to return to Pescatore soon.
author: Linda B.

description:
I came here because I was super excited about the 3 course lunch for SF restaurant week, but I got a little scared after reading the review about it. I didn't think it could be that bad, so I decided to come give it a try anyways. 

I made a reservation just in case, but I didn't really need one. We were like one or two minutes late, and the person at the front actually said we were late... And not just jokingly. I was a bit surprised to hear that, but I didn't take it too seriously. We got seated near the window, but we wanted the higher seats near the bar, so I asked to move. He gave the ok, and we moved. However, our server took forever to come. He said he forgot about us cause we were in the corner... I mean I guess we were, but that doesn't mean you can just not see us. 

I ordered the petrale sole ceviche, grilled ribeye salad, and pear sorbet, while my friend also had the ceviche, but ordered the stuffed cannelloni and chocolate gelato instead. I had high expectations for the ceviche because I love shrimp ceviche. However, this was different from what I expected. Alright it looks different, but I didn't think the taste would be so far off too. The sole was soaked in lime juice and it was waaaaay too sour. I somehow finished the plate by adding pepper, but my friend didn't touch hers at all. 

Awhile after the entrees came. My friend and I split half half of each of our entrees. The ribeye salad was literally a super thin piece of ribeye that I could've probably cooked myself over a HUGE bed of spinach with a few pieces of avocado. 95% was spinach. My friend didn't like the dressing so she didn't even eat the spinach. The cannelloni wasn't good either. I felt like it wasn't fully cooked because the pasta part felt really hard still. The filling wasn't anything special either. Worst of all, my friend found a huge bone inside hers. 

Lastly, we thought you can't go wrong with dessert. Thankfully we were right. I thought we would only get one small scoop but we got two scoops along with the biscotti. The pear sorbet had a really good tart taste but I couldn't really taste the pear. Normally I don't really eat biscottis, but I had to counter the sourness. My friend really liked the chocolate gelato but she wasn't a fan of the biscotti. 

Overall, service wasn't great nor was the food. I wouldn't come back again. This place was such a huge disappointment compared to the 3 course lunch I had earlier this week at Starbelly. I wish I went back there again instead of trying this place.
author: Tina P.

description: Food was ok, and service was bad, a waiter trying to be funny, making fun of one of my friend's accent, not too funny, only him was laughing and a little pricy
author: Ariel J.

description: Had a 6 PM reservation on a Thursday for 3 adults and 2 kids. Very friendly host seated us right away. The food looked and tasted outstanding. All 5 of us loved the whole experience. I had the crab cakes and the seared tuna on top of some of the best greens I have ever eaten.
author: Bob S.

description:
I had 3 small Crab  cakes for $14.50 and some delicious sautéed Spinach with garlic and olive oil so good.
The Crab cake tasted off like it wasn't fresh I  loved their sauce lemon  butter and capers so good.
author: Jay S.

description:
the star of the night was definitely the crab ravioli. it was the best thing we ate on our entire trip. we also had the calzone which wasn't very good. it was burnt on the outside and cold on the inside. and our waitress, who was also a bartender, was rude and made us feel like a burden. but other staff came around and brought our food and checked on us, and they were very nice. and again, the crab ravioli... yeah. 

also, drinks were great. but small.
author: Emily S.

description: Nice happy hour at the bar. Loved the "mule" - gingery with a snap! The seafood anti pasta served on a fiery hot cast iron grill was delicious.
author: Brenda C.

description:
Food was good. They gave us our soup and our meal at the exact same time and the manager helped deliver it. Usually people like to get their courses one at a time and I would think a manager should know that. 

The menu prices are a bit steep but thankfully we had a coupon from the Tuscan hotel that made the bill reasonable.
author: Tim S.

description: Irone is a great server. We stayed at Hotel Zoe and the food was good, service was fast and friendly. Very clean worth the extra $$$. Daily happy hour.
author: Jaime V.

description: Ordered chicken Parmesan. It tasted like fish. Server took it back to kitchen but that's kind of meal ruiner for me.
author: Kathy E.

description: Superb service and delicious food. Packed with tourists, yes, but not a tourist trap. Ordered the crab ravioli and the seafood risotto. The ravioli was solidly good - not great - risotto a better pick. We weren't expecting a menu for the kids, but our very attentive waiter offered us kid-sized pizzas which were perfect.
author: Maria F.

description: Not that this place is known for Irish coffees, but they made the best one I've ever had because it came out so hot! Usually the coffee won't be hot enough or the Jameson cools down the coffee too quickly. But not this one! Service was great, the avocado toast was delicious and surprisingly a little spicy, which I love, and it being a beautiful day in the city made this place even better.
author: Selena M.

description:
Chowder was cold and our order was wrong. It was fixed, then our bill was wrong. 
Bread is too dry and too think on sandwiches.
author: Alyssa F.

description:
Came here for happy hour on a Tuesday. The place was slow as expected but the service wasn't adequately staffed and very inattentive. Overall the food was good and the drink special great but I wouldn't come here again because of the service. The meatball sliders were delicious and the sangria was refreshing. 

Pros: 
Nice location not too far from the touristy fishermans wharf 
Good happy hour deals
Good quick bites like meatball sliders 

Cons:
Very slow service when slow so I can't imagine what the service is like when it's busy
author: Michael T.

description: Excellent service. The restaurant was busy and there was only 2 people working the floor and they worked very hard to get our orders fast. The spaghetti was delicious and the garden salad add salmon! Great location. Spice up the spaghetti with a little crushed red peppers.
author: Gauslin J.

description: This is a wonderful little place! Went here for breakfast not to long ago and i loved the ambience. The staff was friendly and attentive!! Great work Pescatore!  Your management staff is doing an amazing job!
author: Albert B.

description: The food and servife were excellent.  However, the menu etc shown here is NOT the current menu available.  It recently changed owners and the menu changed.  There isn't the same varity or choices.  Would recommend, but don't ecpect what you see here.
author: Michal J.

description: Not the best, very chewy food, terrible tasting drinks. Ended up here by convenience but worth skipping
author: André H.

description:
Went to Pescatore for dinner.  Ordered Seafood Risotto and Grilled Salmon.  Caesar Salad as starter.  Both dishes were very salty.  Salmon was fresh but the polenta was salty.  Seafood Risotto was very salty.  The fish and prawn pieces were fine but the shell fish (mostly small clams) around the Risotto were overly cooked.  They were too dry so did not have much taste.  The Risotto was under cooked and some felt like pebbles. The tomato based sauce was far too salty.  

The table was sticky.  It looked clean but the surface felt soft and sticky.

The service was o.k. and friendly.

Prices were bit high.

The restaurant had to close early because it is under renovation, along with the rest of the hotel building.

The rating is based on the food.
author: Albert C.

description: My man had the the trout and said it was delicious. I had the pizza - very yummy and enough left over for breakfast. Good service and very friendly staff. I thought the pricing was fair considering we dined in SF!!  I appreciate not being charged for my Diet Coke - that was a bonus!!
author: Bella J.

description: Got to love their Happy Hour Pizza.. It's a meal on its own.. I dip the dough on the Olive oil .. Dang .. Their had few happy Hour wine selection but what they offer definitely compliment with the food they have .. This place is walkable from Pier 39.. If you don't want wait times? This is the place to chill out ..
author: Donovan L.

description: This is another place we have frequented during our many stays in San Francisco, And we have had a good experience every time. Recently we were staying at Hotel Zoe and decided to eat at Pescatore again, it's attached to the hotel, and has a dog friendly patio which is very convenient since the Hotel as well is pet friendly. This visit was as just pleasurable as the last several, great food, good drinks and a new menu that was absolutely perfect.. this time we had the pleasure of having Marlowe wait on us, he was quick, efficient, very friendly, and has absolutely lost his mind, which is part of why he is so awesome. As I have said before, if I'm spending a fairly good amount of money on dinner it had not only taste great, but the service had better be spot on as well, and Marlowe and the staff are just that. This place is absolutely worth a visit, great atmosphere, great food and a pet friendly patio that is fairly well protected from the chilly bay winds.
author: Stevie W.

description:
We love this place. Best service by Jose! Recommend great wine! Food was delish!!
Definitely be back.
author: Kristine J.

description: Great ambiance, wonderful service and great food. The black linguine was to die for. Perfect for a date night.
author: Brandon M.

description: The server almost gave my friend an allergic reaction when he told us that the bruschetta did not contain nuts, and was extremely rude. He told some of my friends that they looked fourteen when we were ordering drinks as people who are well over 21. This experience was a dumpster fire. For the money you pay the food is decent, but nothing to write home about. I really would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a calm and professional dining experience.
author: Samantha C.

description: One of the best restaurant in the city. The service was spectacular and the food was amazing! Ambience to start your night or relax. The go to...
author: Rian Angelica L.

description:
Conveniently located next to our hotel (Hotel Zoe) we walked over for breakfast.  Some of the best food we've had so far on our stay.  If at all possible, try to get Jorge as your waiter. He is wonderful! Be forewarned though, I ordered the bacon and eggs and instead got a lot more then I bargained for. When the dish arrived it was loaded with bacon, eggs, potatoes, cantaloupe, and a muffin. So plan on coming with a large appetite. 
Perfect spot to have breakfast before walking the short distance to Pier 39.
author: Dana Z.

description:
*Happy Hour Review*

Convient location between local hotels.  Pescatore was a perfect watering-hole after our hike around the Bay area.  Their adult beverage options are affordably priced and a great deal for the area.  We tried two of the specialty drinks and enjoyed them both; they were quite refreshing.  We highly recommend their Pescatore Ice Tea or Mule for something mildy sweet on a hot, sunny day.  The prices on their domestic beers were a steal at one-third the cost of their competition
author: Bo W.

description: The food was fine. But the service was out of this world. Multiple servers mentioned my daughters' dresses and asked about Wicked. One helped them so their napkins had better coverage. One got my daughter's jacket off the floor. Just felt like the service was worth mentioning.
author: Tobreth H.

description: After a long day of touring SF, I wanted to just relax and have a drink or two but I had to cut it short. The bartender was not nice a bit rude.
author: kin c.

description: I'm so sad that we only ate at Pescatore our very last day in San Francisco for breakfast. We stayed at Hotel Zoe and my husband had the ham omelette and I had the crab Benedict. The food was outstanding, the best we ate in San Francisco by far. The hash browns were the best I've ever had and the service was wonderful! It's a bit pricey, but absolutely worth it!
author: Sarah S.

description: Love this hotel and the little bar but the restaurant wasn't very welcoming. Considering it's a Saturday at 5:30 there were three or four groups of people sat. I asked for a booth, there are only two, and was told it was reserved. The staff wasn't very welcoming and we ended up just leaving.
author: Jessica M.

description: This is about two blocks down from a cable car station, so it's really easy to get to if you're walking. It was about 6 pm and not very busy, so we got our seats quickly and the service was fast. Our server, Jorge, was very nice and helpful with drink suggestions. If there's one thing to come here for, it's the cocktails. The Rum Punch was sweet, but not overwhelming, and my husband said the ginger beer in the Amante Mule was the best. The food, however, was not so great. The presentation was beautifully designed, but the rice on my seafood risotto was a little crunchy and stuck to my teeth and there wasn't a lot of flavor in the organic salad. Overall, the atmosphere sets a nice mood, but the food was lacking. The drinks are superb though and I would recommend going for happy hour.
author: Megan E.

description: If you want bland and overpriced food, this is the perfect restaurant. This brings the restaurant industry in San Francisco to shame. If you feel like eating garlic, try their pizza. Perfect place for some alone time because no one really goes here :)
author: Julia Marie V.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner and had an amazing meal. Our server Marlo was so nice and accommodating. He was very busy and it seemed like he did everything for us. Ask for him when you come in!!! Definitely would come back
author: Veronika V.

description: Great eats. Fun atmosphere. Attentive service. Hidden Gem. Great Happy Hour deals. Start your night here if possible...
author: Emerie S.

description: Really good food! I got the Calamari appetizer's and pizza and the quality of the food was amazing the staff was really friendly as well !
author: Henry S.

description: My boyfriend and I came to this restaurant several years ago and we had a great time then. We decided to visit again last week and we were dazzled by how things changed since our visit. First, the ambience was significantly more casual than we expected. Still, remained the good service and good food - we had a nice dinner; first we had clams, then we enjoyed a Salmon and a Chilean Seabass. Both were wonderful, although we both agreed that the Seabass was the highlight. We had a good time so I do not think this time will be our last one.
author: Jennifer E.

description: Cool ambience. But service was slow when I was here, and the breakfast was nothing special.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
It was hard to find a nice restaurant in the area where we could go for a business dinner. The service was not the greatest but the food was delicious. I called ahead of time to let them know that we all needed separate checks & they said that was okay and do-able but when we got there the waiter said he couldn't do that for us. After a little back & forth they ended up complying (thankfully) but he avoided us almost the entire dinner after our food was served.

I would go back again only because I wouldn't know where else to go that was close to the hotel & a nice enough restaurant for dinner reservations.
author: Maggie Z.

description:
We went to Pescatore twice during our October 2016 SF trip. We were staying at the SF Marriott Fisherman's Wharf and when we checked in they gave us coupons for free drinks. So, we decided to give it a try and grab a late lunch.

The servers were friendly and the food was good. I just loved the Tuscan Meatballs and the drinks were also good.

A problem that I notice (and the main reason why I am giving 3 stars) is that they bring things to the table without asking first if we want and/or without informing us that it is charged (and the amount). It has never happened to us before that a server would bring something without first checking if we needed/wanted.
It happened to us twice while at the Pescatore and I witnessed it happen to other customers there. What they did differently was send the unrequested food back.

On the second visit, during the evening, they had more customers than the first visit and, apparently, they were not coping well with that. We sat at the bar and, even thought there were two bartenders there, it took a long time for them to acknowledge us. Once that happened and we placed the order, the bartender took ages to give us our drinks simply because she didn't know how to make them (and this is the other reason why I am giving 3 stars).

Not sure whether we would go back and give it another chance.
author: Rennie M.

description:
I was truly disappointed with the service at Pescatore. They boast a nice dining experience, not so much. Our server was inattentive and curt.  She didn't even ask us if we wanted drinks or anything. We had to flag her down to ask her for what we wanted. 
I ordered the crab cakes... not impressed. The sauteed spinach was delightful, but how difficult it that.  
We shouldn't have stayed, we had just arrived and were too hungry to roam the city. 
 I assumed they would have better service considering they're connected with the hotel, and are heavily advertised by the hotel.
They were even rude during a take out order. At 9:15, we were told the kitchen was closed, so the menu options were limited. The restaurant doesn't close until 10 o'clock. There was even another customer who came in after we did and was told the same thing. 
 To add insult to injury, after we were  exhausted from a long,great day. We decided to try them one more time. They didn't even include utensils with a to go order. Geniuses!
author: T H.

description: I am Celiac and the staff gets it.  Had a fabulous meal and dessert.
author: Kristina C.

description:
I decided to order a few appetizers instead of a big entree for lunch.

The delivery was semi quick and had a great presentation.

The asparagus and prosciutto had three large slices of prosciutto that is a great accompaniment to the tender asparagus.

However, the item that made my toes curl is the PEI mussels. The mussels itself were VERY small. They came in some tomato broth that had Serrano peppers, garlic, onions, and pieces of tomato. I could have drank a gallon of that!

I ended with the caprese. Most say you can't ruin it, but I have had some bad ones in the past. Pescatore's caprese had thick slices of tomato (a little too raw), large leaves of basil (very fresh), and fresh slices of mozzarella.

My only negative is that the service wasn't as good as I thought it should be.

If you're craving a local restaurant with some good and authentic Italian food, go to Pescatore's. .
author: Leslie S.

description: I came from out of town with my family to celebrate my birthday. Our waiter was so very friendly and helpful. He gave us several tastes of wine to sample before we settled on a bottle. He suggested menu items for us and modifications for my daughter who is a vegetarian. He checked on us throughout the meal and brought us extra sauce, salt, pepper, etc. At the end of dinner he brought us a complimentary dessert and glass of prosecco. We had a truly wonderful evening!!
author: Linda K.

description: If you are staying in the area this is a MUST. I was worried, seeing as I am a local, but I was pleasantly surprised!
author: Christina S.

description: The dinner here was truly delicious. Best Marinara I've ever tasted. My husband has special diet requirements and they were more than happy to accommodate us. Excellent service!!
author: Cheri L.

description: We ate here on two separate occasions during our visit. Thoroughly enjoyed the salmon, New York steak and calzone. However the Mahi mahi was overlooked, hard & dry. Service is great and it's a nice atmosphere so I will not allow one subpar dish to spoil my review nor make me decide never to go again. We will return.
author: Sheri R.

description:
Pescatore is a great little restaurant located a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf aka Pier 39 in San Francisco. My extended family had come up from SoCal and we decided to be tourists for the day. We found Pescatore via Opentable and decided to give it a try.

Our waiter was very friendly, professional, and kept a pretty close eye on us to ensure we had everything we needed.

The food was overall pretty good, although the Salmon I had, as an overall plate, was pretty bland--Salmon + Risotto + Zucchini = Not much flavor variety on the plate. It could've used a sauce or something to make it a bit livelier. We also had an appetizer of Calamari, which was delicious and prepared well.

The Moscow Mule I had was great. They didn't skimp on alcohol like some places do, but the alcohol wasn't overwhelmingly strong. It was a good balance that wasn't watered down.

I think if I'm in the area, I'll try Pescatore again but perhaps will get something apart from the Salmon. I'd definitely recommend visiting.
author: Ryan F.

description: We are local and this place is great. I can't name too many other restaurants outside of our immediate neighborhood that we've been to 4+ times. Worth the local trip (parking is surprisingly cheap and easy or the cable car comes right here) or perfect for something away from the wharf. All winning.
author: Emily Q.

description: On the corner across from Safeway (and also the Fishermans Wharf Sheraton), Pescatore is a restaurant I saw every time I went grocery shopping.  When I saw the 2016 SF Restaurant Week lunch menu, I thought it would be a great time to try Pescatore.  We started with a Petrale Sole Ceviche.  The lime was strong and the finely sliced pepper rings were a perfect spicy aftertaste to the soft (although somewhat chewy) texture of the sole.  The Prosecco I had to go with it was good for cutting through the acidity.  The 2nd course was the ribeye steak salad.  Laced with picked red onion and bordered by creamy avocado slices, the fresh baby spinach salad is topped with generous slices of ribeye steak.  What binds all the flavors together is the well blended light balsamic vinegrette...which lightly dresses the salad without overpowering the flavors of the steak or veggies.  Lunch was finished off by a perfect pear sorbet...fresh and a perfect palate cleansing end to a pleasant lunch. The service was good and the staff friendly.  While this restaurant doesn't wow, it is quite pleasant and not as touristy as I'd imagined.
author: Mitzi A.

description: My new go to spot. Great for a night out with friends or that special someone. Menu was tasty and had something for everyone's pallet. The restaurants ambience is one that all new restaurants strive for. Thank you Pescatore and will see you very soon!!!
author: Jason N.

description: This was a very present surprise. I was staying just across the way at the Sheraton Hotel and saw this in the drive to the hotel. The food was excellent my favorite was the prosciutto I highly recommend that to start. Our server José was very friendly and helpful. They also have a gluten free menu if you are like me and are allergic.
author: Leah P.

description: Came here and was a little hesitant based on some reviews, but my was I pleasantly surprised, the pizza was DELICIOUS, as was dessert ( had the chocolate torte). Enjoyed the meal so much came back the next day for lunch, service was excellent as was the atmosphere!
author: Michelle T.

description: We went for brunch.  I had a freshly made pizza with a sunny side up egg on top. Egg was cooked perfectly.  Alex our server was exceptional.  We will definitely go back.
author: Sandro G.

description: Love this restaurant! Great ambiance and so peaceful! Staff is very nice. Thomas gave us excellent service, we will def come here again and ask for Thomas. He gave us great advice on local visit spots too. He is very attentive and helpful. Great experience!
author: Simo M.

description: Friendly service. Nice, casual place. They have happy hour everyday from 3-6 pm! Only tried appetizers and they are pretty good.
author: Ana M.

description:
Came for a Yelp Elite Event - they served us their entire Wednesday night supper menu! We were all taken care of very well, and the service was really friendly.

A couple girls at my table came late to the event. Even though it all the food had been pretty much served, we asked if they could have any more food the servers actually brought out plates for these girls absolutely stacked with food: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-pescatore-san-francisco?select=Cg-lKt59w_jeg-BXxMt3tA#K1tpWxFFdYZKQb7KH-4G_A
That was nice of them =). 4 stars for the event!

However I'll have to review them based more heavily on their food, to be fair as I usually do. The best food was probably the whole dungeness crab and the spaghetti bolognese.

* whole dungeness crab - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-pescatore-san-francisco?select=Cg-lKt59w_jeg-BXxMt3tA#Cg-lKt59w_jeg-BXxMt3tA
Very fresh, and it came with this nice butter/garlic sauce. I personally just don't like working this much for my food though =/.

* pescatore's famous crab cakes - 3 stars
Not my favorite thing but most people at the table seemed to really like it. They were very flat and densely packed, and the crab meat didn't seem very fresh.

* spaghetti bolognese - 3.5 stars
Can't go wrong here! I enjoyed this. The pasta is on the softer side, which I actually prefer (some people at the table mentioned they prefer more al dente pasta).

* caesar salad - 3 stars
Simple, nothing too spectacular. The lettuce was a little soggy, not too crunchy.

* garlic bread - 2 stars
Very dry, hard, and downright difficult to ingest.

* house red wine - 2.5 stars
Your basic cabernet sauvignon - I'm by no means a wine expert, but even to my untrained palate I thought this had zero flavor and was like watered down wine.

Dinner menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cafe-pescatore-san-francisco?select=Cg-lKt59w_jeg-BXxMt3tA#vMHfruKDMn7cSw53KALWUA
author: Ziyan C.

description: Marlo was the best!!!! If you eat there request him as your server. I will definitely be coming back !
author: Meliza F.

description: Great happy hour with drafts for $3.50. And with bar bites this makes this a great place to eat. We had the 8in pizza ($8) & Garlic fries and Anchor Steam beer
author: Lou M.

description: CREAMY POLENTA in the middle of ROASTED TOMATO SOUP! So soothing after a harried 7 hour drive up the 5 from LA. Atmospheric lighting so my wrinkles were more smoothed out, attentive service from Hernan-more this and please may we have more that-and spinach, I know, spinach, in olive oil and garlic. Just a block away from the Sheraton at Fisherman's Wharf. You would think finding a great place to eat in such a tourist area would be impossible. WRONG! Eat here!
author: Anita P.

description:
If you're staying at the Best Western, you can't beat this location for a breakfast, but the service is anything but quick.

I was seated relatively quickly. Then, I waited a while. Ordered coffee and an omelet.  Then, I waited about 10 minutes to get my coffee.  Got my omelet and finished it. Then, waited about 15 minutes for the check. For a one person, easy to serve breakfast, it took an hour when I could have easily been in and out in under a half. I hardly saw my server during the service.

The omelet was very well made; it would be hard to screw up. The potatoes served with the omelet needed something more; Only the flavor of the potato is present and needed some complimenting flavors. The business also boasts a gluten free menu. For what they're serving, it is very pricey: $13 for the omelet and $3.50 for the coffee.

Maybe just a bad experience on my part, but it appeared there was generally low attentiveness by the staff that caused the slow service. It's okay for breakfast if you're not in a hurry.
author: Aaron T.

description: Really nice restaurant, nice ambient. Food is really  good. I ate chicken parmezan it was delicius. Service was excellent, my server was Alex and he was great.
author: Filip M.

description:
Crab ravioli is fire, cream sauce was perfect. Fresh, high quality,  and large portions. Definitely a good spot to eat on the sidewalk. Food was light, and excellent.
Highly recommend.  Also, try the pulled pork with red sauce and mushrooms. Dank
author: Chrid M.

description: I wouldn't recommend this place. We are in the hotel attached to the building and came for a cocktail last night. The girl working the bar was clearly a "speed" bartender and not only did she have to double check the menu to see what the flagship $15 "barrel aged" manhattan had in it, she didn't measure a single ounce. I've never seen someone pour an expensive sweet vermouth so carelessly. There was no barrel involved either. Our other drink was literally unpalatable so we didn't drink more than the first taste. We came again the next day for happy hour (somewhat cheap drinks) and the gentleman behind the bar was so rude to multiple customers that we watched one walk his ticket because the bartender wouldn't take his money and told him "you're not in a hurry". This place has an attitude problem. They shouldn't be in the business of serving food until they learn how to serve people and be kind.
author: Thomas H.

description: Awesome breakfast/brunch in the Wharf. We shared a few dishes but the banana nut pancakes were glorious; no syrup required. Great little patio and good service.
author: Jamey W.

description:
As locals in the neighborhood,  Pescatore is not bad for a hotel restaurant.  Tourist places can often be "one-fers" meaning a place does not have to care about repeat business because their location alone gives then enough revenue.  Pescatore does better than that. 

The food is good quality and well prepared.  If something is not right,  they are very willing to fix it - so that's why we have come back.  The seafood is fresh (it's by the wharf). The pasta and pizzas are good.  The Ceasar Salad is perfect to tradition.

The bar service and selection are excellent - local brews and vintages, mixed in with national brands expected at a hotel. There is always a good variety on their specials of the day. Of course the is better Italian  if you hike up Columbus,  and better seafood I'd you want to empty your wallet at one of the piers. But for the convenience of Italian seafood in 'the hood' (or close to your hotel room) you will do just fine.  
Stick to what you know you like,  and if it's not what you expected make sure you let then know.  They will make it  right.
author: John K.

description: Food was good but the waitress and manager were horrible!!! Waitress over charged for beers and then used the excuse she doesn't normally work on Mondays and forgot not to over charge us. Waitress said our party of 8 could not have separate checks then she added a 19% tip without telling us. Total scam and if this is how the owner wants to run their business then tourists and the rest of us need to know and not bother giving them our money.
author: Shauna G.

description: We decided on Pescatore because we were staying in the area and wanted some Italian food. Upon arriving 10 min early for our reservation we were greeted by a hostess who confirmed our reservation and then disappeared, leaving us at the host stand alone. The restaurant was approximately 20% populated (many open tables). Another couple came into the restaurant and asked us if anyone was working at the host station. About 5 min later a nice waitress stopped by to ask us if we have been helped and we did say that someone greeted us and confirmed our reservation, but disappeared afterwards. The waitress then tells us that the hostess went on break. ? The waitress apologized and asked us if we wanted a booth and that one would be ready in just a few minutes. 10 minutes later the hostess returned from break and did not say anything to us and grabbed 2 menus and said follow me. The couple and my family were looking at each other and then the husbands both said at the same time "I'm sorry, who are you addressing?"  The hostess said "you two" and then sat the couple. Then across the restaurant a gentleman who was bussing the booth table waved his arms to get our attention that the booth was ready for us. We sat down and a few minutes later was greeting by our waitress. She was very nice. We order 2 glasses of wine and while it took 15 minutes to get the wine, it was good. We ordered our meal: 2 appetizers and a salad and 2 meals. It took almost 15 minutes to get our appetizers: clam chowder for my daughter, my wife and I split calamari. Both arrived cold, had to flag down the gentleman bus man to assist. He was on point and took care of replacing both with hot versions. The calamari was good. The clam chowder was below par on flavor and consistency. I reminded the waitress about our salad that was suppose to come out with the appetizers and she quickly returned with it. Salad was good. Meals came out hot. Daughter had bolognese and we split the seafood pasta. Both were marginal in the taste / flavor dept. summary: the hostess adds no value to this establishment. No management presence at all (it would be humorous if the hostess was actually the manager...) and the food was marginal. Cost was ok but overall it was just not hat good. A shout out to the busser who was working hard and the waitress who did keep it very professional.
author: Joe S.

description: We were in San Francisco for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. We love visiting SF and usually go to the same places time after time. The only place old we went to this trip was the Buena Vista, ya gotta go for the Irish . One evening we decided to try Pescatore's recommended by the concierge at our hotel. It did not disappoint. We loved this place! We started with the warm olives served with focaccia squares, outstanding! Next we had a chopped Caesar salad, delicious. The main course we ordered family style spaghetti, it's only spaghetti...but the best spaghetti ever. The pasta was perfect al dente. All in all this was a deliciously satisfying meal. You will love it too. Give it a try the next time you're looking for spaghetti
author: Arline G.

description: Digging the crab cakes and Trumer Pils. Friendly service at the bar during Dreamforce on a Wednesday night.
author: Diane F.

description: Service was excellent! We loved the bruschetta. The balsamic reduction is amazing. We also really enjoyed the calamari. I only rate pescatore a 3 because the pizza we ordered was lackluster. I believe it was the 4 cheese pizza. We'd return though...we would just try another pizza!
author: Trisha D.

description:
We wanted a place to eat that would be tourist-friendly,  but not touristy.  Pescatore fit the bill.  Our waiter,  a tall, handsome, African-American was fabulous - matching us to wines and knew his menu.   

I had soup and crab cakes while my husband had the seafood skillet sampler.  Excellent and portions were right.  The dessert our waiter wanted to surprise us with was divine - with sabyon cream and marionberries.  Perfect ending to our stay.  

From listening to conversations, we got the feeling we were in a neighborhood restaurant with a lot of regulars.  That was also nice.
author: Carol M.

description:
Second visit, and the food is good, a bit bland at times, but the service is something that will keep me away.  Maybe the hotel will be able to get a new restaurant, or new team for their current restaurant to turn around guest experience.

A couple of things that I don't think should happen in guest service, excuses for example, while we dined a gentlemen came in and asked to sit on the patio, the server replied, "we are a little busy so we may not get to you for a while."  

This was actually our server, who took our drink order, forgot to bring our waters, and when I asked what type of 21st amendment they were pouring, he was unaware that this was the brewery and not the name of the beer.  Of course, this was the last time we did see our waiter until he came to clear the plates.

The food runner did come by to take the order, and drop off the food, and our server then came back to clear our dishes, which I would have thought was nice except he noticed a table next to us had been sitting with empty plates for even longer than we had, so we stopped interacting with us and started to clear there table.

I would have passed on this information to a manager during our brief stay, however there didn't seem to be one working.

There were five tables that were eating dinner (15 guests total), two tables left right as we sat down, so three from that point on, and about 8 guests at the bar.  It should have been an easy task to provide service with the five team members that we saw when we arrived and which grew to seven 35 minutes later when we left.

Brought back my frustration just to write this review but thought it was necessary.
author: Sean M.

description:
The restaurant atmosphere is warm because the dark pine wood furniture. Our seafood pasta and appetizer are cooked perfectly right including seasoning. The staff helped us to choose a glass of wine to pair perfectly with our foods, and we appreciated their knowledge.

This place deserves a 4 star in term of foods and services.
author: Tony T.

description:
I picked this one entirely for its location, right next to Sheraton.  The seafood benedict was just a slice of crab cake underneath the egg, it was soggy and lack any real crab flavor that I was highly anticipating.

The coffee was good, but the waiter never refilled my single cup.  At the end, I paid up and left.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description:
I dined here twice when I was staying at the Sheraton across the street for business and was too tired to go much farther.

Both times I received excellent service, good food and tasty drinks for a pretty good price. I ended up taking advantage of the Happy Hour both times  because I wasn't super hungry. I also got the Tuna Tartare during one of the visits, which is the only thing mentioned not on Happy Hour. The Tuna Tartare was pretty good, I've had better but it was good enough I would order it again. The calamari tasted fresh and good. I also enjoyed the Margarita Pizza both times which did not disappoint.

On one of the visits my colleague & I shared a bottle of the 2012 Punto Final Malbec. It was really good and was only around $30 a bottle.

If I stay in the area again and don't feel like exploring I will definitely eat here again. If you are staying at the Sheraton the concierge has 10% coupons! Although I didn't try to use these since I felt I was already getting a deal with Happy Hour and wasn't sure if you could use both and didn't feel like asking.

I'm still thinking of that wine, I may have to track it down soon!
author: Julie H.

description: Honestly I would have given 0 stars if at all possible ordered the crab eggs Benedict the crab cake I have a seriously question if their crab cake was previously frozen the muffin on it was not warm and though tea was even just a little warm, not cold but not really hot. Now the potatoes were definitely reheated needed more salt and flavor but came to us cold even the hollandaise was on the cold side and bland realistically if you want a nice meal I would go to a fast food shop pay a hell of a lot less and it may not be 5 star but at least some flavor and actually hot. And get better service.
author: A.J. L.

description: I never got the chance to eat because the staff completely ignored me. I had to seat myself.  I had to request a menu. The people around me were attended to. And the people who came in after me were welcomed and seated. Maybe I wasn't the staff's "type". There are far better places in the area to spend time and money.  Far better treatment everywhere. I found some great places because I wasn't served and left. BUTTERFLY on the Embarcadero is amazing. BOUDIN is great at keeping it simple and good. Both value their customers.
author: Jomarie B.

description:
Christmas Disappointment
Attractive food genre, awesome location and warm atmosphere... unfortunately these are the only pros.

The cons...
Ridiculous wait - 15 minutes before we met our bus person, 30 minutes for the drink/food order to be placed and a total of 90 minutes for dinner delivery. 

An hour after ordering they informed us they had no chicken and made concessions. The downfall is the cooking of the replacement items didn't catch up with the original order. Under cooked food mixed with cold dishes. 

The service from start to finish failed miserably. The food could of been awesome, unfortunately the service ruined the potential.

Save your money and yelp a better alternative.
author: Luau W.

description: We were able to get last minute reservations here for thanksgiving. Our dinner was delicious our server was nice and friendly. Great bar selections. Everything was delicious!
author: Brenda S.

description:
My husband and I live in SF, and we rarely venture into the Wharf, but we were so happy to find Pescatore on our most recent date night.  Pescatore may be in a tourist district, but the food is comparable to that you find in the more exclusive dining enclaves in SF, except that the portions are hearty and the prices are good.

The service was a bit slow at times but, for me, that was more than made up for by a delicious apple salad, blackened tuna and polenta entree and a nicely made cup of decaf coffee for dessert.
author: R P.

description: Very good service. Even though it's slightly off the tourist trap areas of fisherman a wharf, the food was mediocre. Definitely lots of way better restaurants in SF.
author: Wanlan X.

description:
We dined as a large party (7 work associates) on a Tuesday evening. They offered each of us a shrimp amuse bouche for booking the reservation through Open Table - fun touch. Our server Chelsea was fun and made great recommendations and accommodations (hi, gluten free menu!). 

One of our party accidentally broke a wine glass, and glass landed in her entree. Chelsea quickly and graciously replaced the wine and got a new entree underway. Very professionally handled. 

Not cheap, but great food and kind service.
author: Stefany B.

description:
Awful! Service started out fine but confused. Our drink order came twice and entrees that we didn't order were delivered and then taken away. The bread was bland and the tomato soup was pretty much just pasta sauce. Entrees were very slow to come out.

I ordered a special (risotto). A different risotto was delivered and by the time I realized it, the waitress had disappeared to chat in the back of the restaurant (which was mostly empty) and I couldn't get her attention. A different waiter stopped by to take the dish and apology. Apparently the special I ordered was from a different day of the week - the menu got mixed in with today's batch. They fired the right entree for me. It was ridiculously spicy. I'm pregnant and it immediately hurt my stomach.

I gave up at that point and headed back to the hotel leaving my poor husband alone. After 15 minutes, the manager finally noticed something was up - waitress was no where to be found again. The manager agreed it was inedibly hot. He was nice enough to take it and the tomato sauce soup off the bill which STILL managed to come to $70 for one app, one beer and one entree.

Overpriced, bad to mediocre food, slow to nonexistent service. Go elsewhere!!
author: Karen L.

description:
Yes, the food is amazing. Yes, the decor is tasteful. But the real reason this restaurant stands out is the exceptional service, delivered specifically by a sweet gal named Mary.

I asked for a recommendation for a drink with gin, and she suggested the Leapfrog, which I absolutely LOVED. I ordered three.

For dinner we had the seafood fettuccine and the salmon which were both cooked to perfection (also Mary's suggestion after being asked what her favorite dishes were).

She delivered every course with grace and kindness. Truly made us feel welcome and even important.

We will be coming back and requesting Mary as our server. If you'd like an exceptional meal served with class and a genuine smile, you should too.
author: Morgan B.

description: Great chicken parm. Nice little place and well priced for the area. Much better cuisine than most surrounding places have to offer.
author: Tim L.

description:
Great date night here! The food and service was great and the restaurant has a good vibe. Indoor and outdoor seating. 

They have gluten free spaghetti noodles. Just be prepared for a longer wait since it takes longer to cook. 

Will definitely come back for the seafood pasta!
author: Mrs. K.

description: Chelsea, Mary, Lou and George are so fantastic! Each of them made me feel so welcome. Super attentive and friendly! Oh...and the food and wine is dynamite! This foodie and traveler highly, highly recommends!!
author: Barbara G.

description:
Typical casual place in a touristy type area.  The food isn't outstanding, but it is solid - I had the seafood risotto and the flavor was good although I got a bit of sand/dirt in the clams.  Mondays are happy hour all evening and so that is the real draw.  The HH cab was simple, cheap, and good.

I got out of here for $30 with a glass of wine and an entree... I can't complain.  I would return.
author: Michael S.

description: We just tried this place since we stay at hotel Zoe. I'd been in restaurant business, so I don't like to complain about food and service. However, this was my worst experience ever at the restaurant. I literally could complain every single plate. My wife ordered sangria which tasted like rubbing alcohol. Then, she had to ask to changed to pinot noir. And that pinot noir was tolerable but she wouldn't order second glass. We had calamari as an appetizer. That was just ok but we are in San Francisco. They could serve much better calamari with that price!!! Later on we got our entrees. I had crab ravioli which was pasta and crab meat were so dry. Especially, the crab meat was almost like eating dust. My wife had risotto. We know what Al Dente is like. The rice totally was  undercooked. She had only couple spoons of it. The worst part is here. Our server could see we had only few bites, yet he didn't even ask if there was anything wrong with the food. Really? This is the service you get for $100.00 meal? We didn't complain at the restaurant, but I want someone who wants to go there to know that if you want some pizza or spaghetti? maybe fine but don't go there if you looking for real Italian. I don't even want to give them an one star. Horrible experience!!!!!
author: Steven Y.

description: Best vodka hot chocolate-warms your right up. Great service. We also tied the meat balls and the polenta very good. ask for Eddie
author: Thatiana T.

description: I live nearby and have been here before and had good experiences, the reason why I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1. Very nice atmosphere also. Today the service was bad and the food worse. After waiting ages and complining about the delay, we finally got our dishes. Both were bad. The cod was practically raw, the seafood dish had large shrimp that were not properly de-veined. Not recommended today, but as I mentioned, it was good on other occasions.
author: Stephen B.

description:
We stayed at the Radisson and ordered carry out from here and we're very disappointed.  

Appetizers: We got the Cesar salad that was drenched in basically mayonnaise and lacked both flavor and quantity. The bruschetta was ok except the bread was soaked in balsamic dressing making it soggy and damp. The fresh basil was its only saving grace. 

Main dish: The spaghetti bolognese was so salty we could barely eat it. Not sure if it was from the braised pork and beef in the meat or just added to afterward but we couldn't finish it. 

All in all spent $45 on a meal we had to eat again somewhere else later that night.  There are plenty of other options in the Warf area to chose from and I wouldn't recommend eating here. 

It gets 1 star for location and making food-like things.
author: Peter H.

description: Three words: Get the ceviche. I'm too full and happy to write much more! Everything was delicious and fresh, the service was amazing (Jose rocks!) and the cocktails were awesome.
author: Donna C.

description:
My wife and I have driven past Pescatore quite a few times.  We live about 3 blocks away and decided to check it out for a late lunch on a Saturday. The place was not over crowded and we were seated immediately.  Our server, Marlowe was definitely entertaining and easy to interact with.  Something that was great for a slow Saturday afternoon.  

If you have read any of my previous reviews I am a sucker for a cocktail list which they have.  I tried a total of 3 cocktails : Caribou (ehh), Kick of the Jams (heavy bourbon pour) and another rum cocktail.  It was my third drink so I definitely forgot the name.  We ordered the Crab Ravioli, Crab Cakes, Steak Panini and Pear Bread Pudding.  In general, everything was decent.  The panini was on focaccia and not pressed but that is a common thing I see in San Francisco.  I might be wrong but I thought paninis were supposed to be pressed.  Either way, it was a decent steak sandwich.

Considering the place's name roughly translates to Fish Restaurant I was a little surprised at the lack of fish on the menu.  This was because we were there for lunch.  I checked out the dinner menu and they definitely had a few things I would like to try.

The definitely doesn't feel touristy.  My wife and I generally liked the vibe and atmosphere.  I am definitely excited to go back for dinner.  Hopefully the Halibut, Sea Bass or Rib-Eye are delicious.
author: Cortlin H.

description: Not many options for dinner on Christmas so we stopped in here. It's in an older fisherman's wharf hotel, sorta set back a couple of blocks from the craziness. The service was outstanding considering they were short handed. The food was just average. Meatball sort of tasted like Chef Boyardee. Bland and not much flavor in the sauce. Caprese salad was ok but honestly you could get something just as good from Safeway across the road. It's a meal and good service though.
author: Heath H.

description:
Returning natives.

After the excellent first visit grabbed my fellow San Franciscan sister and came back for for another round. Still enjoyable if not quite as good before.

Started with homemade granola and fruit with lowfat yogurt. Impressive assortment of fruit though the crunchy and sweet granola was in short supply. Unfortunate for $11.

Finished with a veggie panini (eggplant, zucchini, spinach) on homemade focaccia. Appreciated swapping pesto spread for homemade marinara. Side of greens too.

Thought much like the granola it was a too steep $13.

Similar to the first time service was quite friendly and welcoming but Marlowe was unfortunately not working. Perhaps he could have saved a star with a signature save.

Not just for tourists. Also no longer just five stars.
author: Jason B.

description: This place was recommended to us but it was a sad, expensive meal. Boring pasta and crap service were the low-lights. Bruschetta was a bit redeeming and the happy hour price of half-off some bottled wine was nice. $22.00 for a bottle of Syrah with dinner was the cheapest we found in San Francisco.
author: Troy B.

description: Attached to a Best Western, but a nice one called the Tuscan so I didn't expect much. Meeting a friend staying at hotel for a quick drink, and ended up getting the polenta as an app.  It was tasty, but really should be called grits, because it was soupy.  Not at all a "polenta".  The house wine was average, and more expensive than is deserved...even for SF.  The atmosphere is actually lovely with dark wood and a fireplace; open kitchen and small bar. The service was a little shy on speed, and the waiter originally gave my app to the table next to me, who thought it was a comp app for them. I was lucky they didn't dive into it, before they saw me looking and all realized it wasn't theirs. There are better places to eat, but it's a real nice convenience if you are staying at this hotel.
author: Kai F.

description:
Worst recommendation ever. I took the fish special and the greens included were so bitter that it ruined the entire meal. I wish I hadn't taken it to go and tipped 25%. I'll never be back.

P.S. Horribly slow service.
author: Steph A.

description:
Staying at the Hyatt and looking for a place nearby that had some good fish entrees and the Warriors game on. The host was very accommodating and arranged some tables for us near a tv. Our group shrunk and the bar tables weren't working with our 4 & 1 year old so we switched tables. 
We are from Napa valley and I work in the industry so my standards are extremely high. We were promptly greeted by Mary, who ended up being such a delight! I was in for a shock when the arugula, blue cheese and apple salad came. I order those everywhere and this may have been my personal fave! My husband has a stomach disease and had to modify his entree and it came out perfectly. I got the chicken parm(boring I know) but I ate the WHOLE DISH! Which was huge! 
My 4 year old got a hot chocolate at the end which they purposely made a little less hot so she didn't get burned, which was a very sweet touch!
Over all, food was fantastic, Mary was amazing and the whole ambiance was just perfect.
author: ChrisJessalyn H.

description: I recommend the crab cake benedict for breakfast!!  It was absolutely delicious and their service is great.
author: Lilly G.

description:
I was so disappointed to have wasted one of our San Francisco meals here. The reception by the host was weak. We had a reservation via Open Table, but he hastily tried to prep a table right next to the door for us. (Perhaps because we had teenagers with us?) We had to ask at least twice before they gave us a different table. The restaurant wasn't half full. One of these days I will learn to recognize these early cues and have the guts to walk out. 

But, we stayed. My son ordered meatballs that were not fully cooked and had at least one bone chip. I ordered crab ravioli and the cream sauce was so bland (white and reminded me of glue) it ruined the crab flavor. My other son loves clam chowder and thought it would be a good bet at a restaurant that specializes in seafood. Unfortunately it was awful. Apparently they used the same base as the cream sauce -- the strongest flavor in it was celery! He found one piece of clam in the entire bowl. So sad. 

Good news: Everyone loved the bread and the olive oil was good quality.  Kudos to our server who genuinely seemed like a nice guy. He adjusted our bill. These were the only saving graces.

With so much amazing food in San Francisco, Pescatore was a huge disappointment. They think they are better than they are. For creative, fresh ingredients with great service try Pacific Catch instead.
author: Andrea M.

description: My first trip back since I moved out of state, I was looking forward to the mac n cheese after a devastating Giants loss to the Dodgers. My party ordered some olives drinks, and a pizza, as we were told they no longer served my beloved mac n cheese. We ate the scorching hot olives and then got our bill...without the pizza. It was forgotten, and we were the ONLY people there. I'll cut them a little slack since it was nearing closing time and maybe the pizza was "forgotten" on purpose. It is no longer on my "must visit when I'm back in The City" list.
author: Christina H.

description:
Cafe Pescatore. It's not just your ordinary tourist trap. 

The service and food did not disappoint.

Recommendations:
Crab Ravioli topped w/ greens & cream sauce (fresh)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jdKWSulGisIZ6zaXrAprvQ?userid=Rp8hHh-2U8Nh-7FhhspVxQ

Pizza Bianca topped w/ four cheeses, mushrooms, & truffle oil (delish)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jdKWSulGisIZ6zaXrAprvQ?select=40zSUTLyQQQd7drEKf5lEA

Tips:
-Happy Hour from 2pm-5pm ($3 wine/beer, $7/ cocktails)
-Metered parking (bring quarters)
-Garage parking ($6/hr)
-Bathroom located inside connecting hotel
author: Joy A.

description: If Marlo is your waiter, you will enjoy a fabulous meal and excellent service.
author: Monique N.

description: I love this place this is the 3rd time here and Is just delicious, Paulette recommend me the seafood fettuccine and it was spectacular, good job guys !!!! :)
author: Mario V.

description: Food was cold and not tasty. I would definitely not recommend this place. Ordered egg benedict and veggie frittata. But the waiters were friendly and waived off our bill for one of the item.
author: Munch B.

description:
We went to Pescatore at the last minute, as our hotel was across the street and we couldn't get in to the other two places that were recommended.  Their loss!  Our gain!
A lovely, attentive local restaurant, miles ahead of the two nearby Fisherman Wharf tourist traps masquerading as fine dining which fleeced us.  Our man Marlowe was a terrific server; the drinks were imaginative and satisfying; the food (a limited, but intelligently selective menu) was first-rate.
My only regret about Pescatore is that is across the continental US from where we live; otherwise, my wife and I would be weekly regulars.  Thanks for making SF a culinary success, Pescatore!
author: Laurence M.

description:
First me we went it was ok. The service was slow, but I believe that's because the got very busy all of the sudden ad were short staffed. 

Food was good, not great and because we sat outside we really didn't mind how long everything took. 

Second time we went it was much better service wise. Food was still good, not great. 

We would go back if were we in the area, but most likely we won't ever go here again.
author: Cody H.

description: Small place, a little relaxed but good service. The restaurant seems to be frequented by many locals. The clam chowder was cooked to perfection and the bruschetta fresh and tasty. The Pappardelle special was particularly good, homemade with a creamy tomato sauce, chicken and vegetables, yum! Service was efficient. Nice dessert options. There is a small amount of outdoor dining but I noticed that diners were interrupted several times by beggars so that did not seem to be a good option.
author: Alicia R.

description:
The place was alright overall. We only decided to eat here because everywhere else had a really long wait (it was July 4th during dinner time). 

The service was alright. Our waitress came by a few times to check up on us. 

There was really nothing special about the food. I ordered a BASIL PESTO PIZZA (shitake mushrooms, spinach, onions, chili flakes, fontina cheese), which came out to be $13 dinner price (Note: they have different pizzas for their lunch and dinner menus). It was a good amount for me, I finished the entire pizza except for a few crust pieces here and there. Was it worth $13? I didn't really think so but considering the ambience of the place, that might be the reason why it was a bit overpriced. I've had better, bigger pizza during Happy Hour at Yardhouse (maybe that was what I was comparing it to). 

They certainly didn't skimp out on the cheese, the basil added great flavor, and the shitake mushrooms were also well done (a big mushroom fan). I didn't really see any need for the chili flakes though. Not sure if they were just trying to make it fancy, but the bit of spiciness really did not mesh well with the other flavors, it was definitely out of place. I can't quite put it into words why.

Would I come here again? Most likely not.
author: Diana N.

description: The food was great and the staff was very friendly. If you appreciate great customer service, you'll appreciate the staff of this place. They are quick, check up on you often, and since we were new to the city our waiter gave us some great recommendations to check out. We ordered some drinks and happy hour menu items. Don't know how their other food is but must be good. Had a great experience! Must check out! You won't regret it! Charles, the bartender was amazing and made our experience really great. Thanks Charles!
author: Jane H.

description:
Came here because it was attached to the hotel Best Western ( super awesome service and comfy rooms btw). This place has a happy hour from 3-6 and it serves a really good charcuterie board. The server was really nice, not sure what his name was but he was tall and had glasses. The hostess was also very sweet.

Now let's get to the food . I recommend getting the clam chowder. My god, was it delicious . It was definitely fresh. The clams were outstanding and the soup itself was on another level of good. The calamari was just nice and crispy and it's served with a really good sour-ish sauce. As far as the charcuterie board, just get it. It's awesome and it totally makes for a good photo
author: Pat S.

description:
We came as a big party on Saturday night without reservation. The hostess suggested that we walk to little Italy since she does it all the time and the wait would be over an hour.  She probably didn't see that we had 4 little kids with us, all exhausted and hungry. We were so disappointed but LUCKILY, Joseph - not sure if he's the owner but for sure he acted like one- was able to move a couple of small tables to make a table for us right away. I think he even had to move a customer by giving him a free dessert so that he can put 2 small tables together for our party.  Long story short, Joseph was our SAVIOR! Then, the not as good part was that the service was so slow.  The server came right away to take orders but he disappeared and didn't come back with water and bread for a long time! Luckily, we ordered appetizers so the kids were happy for a little while while waiting for their food and water. Granted it was a busy night but they should have known and staff appropriately. 
The food, however, was very good! We ordered seafood pasta, grilled chicken pasta, shrimp pasta, all good and delicious! We also added a side dish that NEVER came! So, all in all, great owner! Great food! If it wasn't for the slow service, I would have given them a 5 stars!
author: Jackie P.

description:
I had family visiting from out of town and I am glad they picked this place for all to eat.   Food was tasty and fresh.   Pizza/ bread/ Spaghetti/.... Everything was good.   I would go again.    Thanks.   

TIRAMISU IS THE BEST HERE !!!!!!
author: Kharazm S.

description: I am remiss in not submitting a review sooner. This place exceeded our expectations, especially since it is attached to a hotel.
