We came down to SF for a quick business trip and stayed close to the wharf. I had compiled a list of restaurants that I wanted to try during the 4 nights we were there. We were exhausted our first night there so decided go downstairs and try the hotels restaurant, not expecting much. WOW! Were we surprised. The food, the service, the ambience and the drinks were superb. Hard to believe this is a hotel restaurant. We ended up eating at Pescatore 3 of the 4 nights in San Francisco. We did not have one negative experience and tried something different each night. The portions were perfect and our server, Jorge, went  above and beyond to provide excellent service. Cannot recommend this place enough. Great bang for your buck!
author: Elle B.

description: Great atmosphere, in the Tuscan hotel so easy for us who were staying there. Eddie and Charles best bartenders and very friendly make good mule drinks and chicken Parmesan is a must eat!!!
author: Traci H.

description: I feel like the food portion should be bigger for the price. I ordered the crab ravioli, the menu didn't include a lot of the things that were on the dish and I found out it was pickled (ew). The staff was pretty courteous and was in a convenient location for us.
author: Hope S.

description:
Pescatore's food, service, and ambiance was across the board mediocre.

A group of 8 of my friends ended up here because we happened to be in the Fisherman Warf Area and Pescatore had room for us. Although nothing was necessarily bad, I definitely would not go out of my way to eat here.

My group stuck with pizzas and pastas, most of which tasted like they were from Olive Garden. I think the waiter actually forgot about our table, meaning we had to ask for more water and the check.
author: Ashwin S.

description: Loved the capello pomodoro! Very nice ambiance! Service is excellent!  They have a nighly special, like Salmon tonight.  Recommend it.
author: Lucie D.

description: The food leaves a lot to be desired. It is not bad by any means but it did not blow me away like the Hollywood cafe which I just around the corner. I ate breakfast here because I stayed in the best western that's attached. I wouldn't eat here again but I would stop by the bar for a cocktail. I had a Bloody Mary with my breakfast and it was one of the best I've ever had.
author: Cristina H.

description:
Love this place! Even more so since the renovation. With friendly and patient staff, Pescatore is a safe harbor from the craziness of other restaurants in north beach and fisherman's wharf.

On this particular visit, our server Mary went out of her way to help me choose vegetarian options which can often be a nightmare at Italian restaurants.  She even pointed out substitutions and off menu items that the kitchen could make. I almost jumped ship when the chicken parmesan came out... but I held true and went with a Caesar salad, the roasted polenta and the Verde pizza which had pesto mushrooms and spinach. 

Everything was amazing and made even better by the gin based 'Aviations' that the bartender Chris kept preparing :)

I will continue to consider this place one of my favorites in San Francisco.
author: Sean O.

description: My husband and I really enjoyed dinner here! The food was delicious, and the service excellent!!
author: Annalisa L.

description: Nice, bright, comfortable little corner diner a block (or two) off Fisherman's Wharf.  I think I would have enjoyed it more but I found it a little pricey for a quick breakfast before heading out.  But they do have a few suitable a la cart items to fill the void until lunch in Sausalito.  If you're ok w/ $20 per for breakfast, well worth the stop.
author: David J.

description: Great food with lots of flavour. Waiter a little slow with cheese and pepper topppings for pasta as well as water refill but I would come back.
author: Tony G.

description: This review is regarding their private dining only, not the food or restaurant itself.  I was interested in hosting a private dinner party at Pescatore and I emailed Debbie Jimenez per the restaurant's instructions on their website and 2 weeks later, I still have not received a response.
author: Yien S.

description: Stumbled upon this place in search for dinner and we're so glad we did. The ambiance was great (though our neighbors probably wouldn't say the same since we were "those loud people"). Appetizers and dinner were exactly what we were looking for, spaghetti and meatballs (such big balls!) and pizza margherita. We kept the whiskey drinks coming, so that's always a plus. I think the main reason we enjoyed our visit last night was because our server, CHELSEA, was amazing! She made the whole experience unforgettable and will definitely be making sure we stop by again in hopes to get seated in her section!
author: Kelly K.

description: Meh, nothing special. It is pricy for the quality of food they make. It is the touristy location so that explains why could it be so.
author: Svetlanko I.

description: Good food, but corkage fee too high. My sea bass was outstanding but my friends' capellini pomodoro was bland. Excellent service!
author: Debbie S.

description: What a lovely gem! We were staying at the Best Western Tuscan to which it is adjacent. The service was prompt, the food was delicious and, more importantly, not too pricey. The drinks were, but the bartender had the skills to back it up. If I could, though, I'd give it 4.5 stars, as the cocktail glasses were clearly not chilled before use which, as all my fellow cocktail fanatics know, is a big no-no. Still, the taste was more than acceptable; I recommend the punch.
author: Bill E.

description: Clam chowder was the best we had while in SF. Pizzas were fresh and hot - worth the wait. Nice ambience and great service. Great walking distance from various hotels on the Fishermans Wharf.
author: Jill D.

description:
Went to this restaurant for our anniversary because of reviews from another website showing it in the top 10% of SF restaurants. VERY disappointed in both the food and the service! 

First, it was so loud we couldn't talk to each other without yelling. 
Second, we asked our waitress for a wine recommendation and she said "try a merlot or a sangiovese". Not exactly what I was looking for. Perhaps she was new. Not much attention from her the entire evening.
The food? The bruschetta was very good. For dinner I ordered chicken parmesan and didn't finish it. My wife had crab ravioli. Both dishes were bland. Did not feel like chancing it on dessert so we called it a night.
author: Barry P.

description:
Really enjoyed the fun/friendly staff.  Bartender had me cracking up, and let me have the tv remote to watch Warriors game.  Will definitely be coming back.

Food was delicious and portions were just right.
author: Trent S.

description:
Northbeach/ Fisherman's Wharf is far from my destination for fine dining in SF.  However when friends from out of town were staying in the area , hubby and I packed ourselves into our IQ and headed off to the "other side" of town.  After much deliberation over where to eat we settled on Pescatore.  It was conveniently located, parking wasn't a nightmare and they had room for our party of 5 on a Sunday night.

The restaurant itself is simple and nice inside.  Not stuffy or trying to be too kitchy.  Our server Marlowe was amazing!  He was lively, kind, professional and made the evening .  Food was about a 3.5 but the overall experience was a 4.  Our arugula/ frisee  apple salad was super tasty, not over dressed and a generous portion.  We had three different fish dishes and two pies.  The pizza definitely looked fine but I am spoiled in the pie dept and since I didn't try them, I will not review them.  The sea bass was a lovely cut of fish and perfectly prepared, however I thought the sauce was a little heavy.  I am sure it would appeal to most people; I just like my fish served a little lighter.  My husbands fish was perfect.  It was the trout special of the day and was LOVELY.  Light, flaky and super flavorful.  He had the winner of the night. Portions are generous.  Prices not bad for the area.

Desserts were yummy, I loved the bread pudding and the fresh blackberry parfait.

I can't say I will become a regular because of the distance from my house, but when people are staying in the area I will definitely direct them to Pescatore.
author: Monika S.

description:
Spending Friday in San Francisco we planned on Pescatore for our linner.  To late for lunch and too early for dinner.
Our server was Mary.  She was nice and waited on us straight away.  We ordered chicken panini and crab cakes.  Both were very tasty and the drinks were to our liking.
We will return to Pescatore on our next visit.  Good food & drinks.  We did read the other reviews and due to the time we visited, didn't experience some of the concerns the others had.
author: Jim N.

description: Food was good, but not spectacular. We had paninis and fries/salads. Our server, however, was great - and this made all the difference. Friendly, fun, and attentive. Not sorry we went there...but not likely to return.
author: Andrew J.

description:
Let me start by saying that I grew up in San Francisco.  My husband and I are homeowners here in the city and, because we both love being here, we work hard to stay in San Francisco.  With this being said, the time we spend together, where we go for breakfast, lunch or dinner is important to us.

We like taking our motorbikes out on the weekends.  Just this past Sunday, we did so and decided to stop in to Pescatore for breakfast.  We asked for a booth, were told the last remaining one was "reserved", which irked me a little, but we were hungry so, we chose to eat in the bar area.  A waiter by the name of Juan came over to our table after we'd been seated by the manager, Francisco. We ordered coffee and water, no ice, with lemon along with breakfast.  We had napkins but no flatware. 

We probably waited a good 15 minutes before our coffee arrived which was fine given we were talking.  We noticed a young couple behind us get seated by Francisco.  Juan, our waiter and I'm assuming the couple behind us' waiter was nowhere to be found.  

After about another 15 minutes, our breakfasts arrived.  I had ordered an English muffin, NOT toast.  I got toast.  There was no butter, no flatware and our water wasn't delivered until well after we'd begun eating.  The water had ice in it after I'd specifically asked for no ice.  My husband had to get up and get us our flatware as well as ask for butter for his toast. The couple behind us, who were not acknowledged by Juan after he served our breakfasts, left the restaurant.

At this point, we've finished our breakfast and are waiting for the check. We wait another 15 minutes and don't receive the check.  Again, Juan, our waiter, is nowhere to be seen.  Now, I'm pissed at the lack of care we've received.  

I ask to speak to the manager.  A heavy-set latino man mumbles something and half-way points to Francisco.  I let Francisco know in a very loud voice that we come there to have breakfast, relax and enjoy ourselves. I remind him that we are NOT tourists and that we like to frequent the same places again and again explained, in detail, why we were dissatisfied with the unconscious service we received per Juan.  

Francisco took care of my husband and me.  He apologized for the waiter Juan's behavior and assured us that should we come back, this will not happen again.

Thank you, Francisco for remedying the behavior of Juan, the errant staff member.  Please remember what we discussed...you cannot play, "Daddy" to all your staff and expect them to do things for themselves at your level.  Make them work as hard as you do and hold them accountable. Long short of this is this...Francisco, train them to work for you and be just as good if not better than you.    That's why you're in charge, you're the manager.  Because you listened and treated us well, we'll be back.

Thanks again for everything.
author: Alacrity I.

description:
I'm thinking, after reading other Yelpers reviews, we probably lucked out. 

Upon entering, we were seated immediately, and while casing out the joint, I noticed ( and so did the wife) a really nice looking steak on one of the patrons plate. While on another table, some nice sized shrimp. 

Kyla, our server was very prompt with our waters, helpful, and attentive to our cocktail orders right away. I like that, I like to sit, order a drink, and THEN mull over the menu. 

For our appetizer, we ordered the Bruschetta for $8.00 Now I don't claim to be any kind of Italian food connoisseur, but when we dine Italian, I always get that. And brother... this was the best to date. If I were a vegetarian, I'd eat this daily. 

Main entrees: I had the Gamberi Fra Diavolo ( $22.00) roasted jumbo prawns, spicy tomato compote, on fried polenta cake. Prawns were cooked perfect, not over done and hard. Gotta say the sauce WAS quite spicy, the way I eat my food, but I think a warning to others might be warranted. 

The wife got the Bestecca ($25.00) Grilled rib eye cooked to right on the money medium rare. Must admit the wife and I are meat carnivores, and this steak ranks up there within the top three favorites! Soooo tasty, just the right seasoning, and tender.... oh my! You could almost cut it with a fork, while it seemed to just melt in your mouth... Heaven. 

For dessert, we were both wondering what's a chocolate tort? Kyla explains, it's like a warm chocolate brownie, filled with chocolate, with raspberry sauce, and vanilla gelato. Lemme tellya folks worth every bit of $7.50. The cake like brownie, so warm and so moist. The chocolate center, doesn't just run out as you take a piece, it OOZES out ever so slowly... so warm.. so thick and chocolaty... so DECADENT! 

I'm sorry other Yelpers, couldn't have had an experience like ours, but like I said in the beginning , maybe we just lucked out.
author: Joe K.

description: I had such a great experience here the food is just as great as the service. Our server Marlowe was so pleasant such a friendly guy. We had the seafood fettuccine which was delicious and a meatlovers pizza. Dessert was so good it was creme with berries tasted so heavenly if I wasn't so full I would have asked for seconds.
author: Lainey G.

description: Great service and food. The tomato soup and mussels are delicious starters. Staff was very attentive and personable. Would definitely return when in the bay area.
author: Leah G.

description:
It wasn't bad. But it was definitely not good. It was basically not memorable. I would like to say though that the service was good and they have some nice views. By the way, I'm rating this place against all of the other Italian Seafood places in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Frankly, it's not fair to rate this place against places in North Beach or other parts of the city because it honestly wouldn't fare so well. 

Anyway, their Cioppino was good and all the other stuff was just sauced with too much tomato sauce. This place is great for families though. And they probably won't be disappointed with anything really. It's just not a place I would go out of my way to go to again.
author: Rylan C.

description:
If you want to wait 10 minutes just for a waitron to say hi then this your kinda place!!

Came in the evening at 6:33 - place was fairly busy but not full. We were greeted and seated outside.

From there on out we waited 10 minutes just to get menu's ... 20 minutes just to order our appetizers, and by the time it came out we could have toured half of Cali (okay not really haha)! But it was just that bad ... never before have a waited so long for so little ... well, there was this one ex of mine (aha I keed!).

Save yourself for a better place. The food wasn't even that great. At least we made a good choice on the wine we had. And the one waiter was pretty friendly. But the mediocre food (some dishes were okay, others just not great at all) and terrible service get this place just two stars in my book.

Maybe they were just having a bad day and were under-staffed - either way, let us know. And at least pretend to care and stop by to see if everything is okay ... rather than disappearing for 20 min at a time.
author: Randy P.

description: Sat outside. Great 70s music. OK I'm an old fart. Very good Cab. Five Rivers. Service was really good. I was a little amazed for all the bad service reviews. My waiter, Irone, was great.
author: William M.

description:
Wow. Quite impressed after reading the negative reviews on here. Stopped in for an impromptu dinner after a Niners game. At 5pm on a Sunday there was no wait and we were greeted by a very friendly waiter who sat us (black guy with glasses, not sure of his name). After a little friendly chit chat we were seated and immediately our waiter took out drink order. Very knowledgeable about the local beers on tap (including 21st Amendment!). 

I went basic with the Chicken Parm and it was about a 3.5/5. Nothing special but nothing bad either!

My date got the Sea Bass which she raved over and rated it a 5/5!  

What earned this restaurant 5 stars was the service. Being on crutches for a bit they were more then welcoming in showing me where the bathrooms were (it's a little bit of a walk), getting a table by the door, allowing me to prop my foot up on a chair and overall friendliness. Even gave recommendations about what local bars to try out!!

Would be back again if I lived in the city!!
author: Derrick J.

description: I went here with my family a little hesitant from the previous reviews. Our server Marlowe was exceptional! Friendly staff, great service and great food! I ordered the rib eye dinner and the crab cakes appetizer. Both were delicious
author: Kayla P.

description:
No wait for an amazing brunch!  Very reasonably priced for the city!  Eggs benedict was hubbys breakfast and cooked to perfection!  Cinnamon raisin toast with strawberries on top for me sas amazing!  Kids had scrambled eggs, bacon and potatoes and loved it!
All in all, excellent breakfast!
author: Michaela T.

description:
I came today to this restaurant with my family for dinner as recommended by hotel staff.

There were some good things here. Our waiter was really friendly and really good about giving recommendations about the food. 

We ordered calamari for our appetizer. It was more buttery than calamari I am used to and I found it quite tasty. 

However, the entrees were so-so.

I had ordered the homemade capellini pomodoro with chicken. It was a simple dish and I found it tasty, but it was $16 plus chicken was an extra $6. So, 22 dollars for quite a small portion. Just not quite worth it.

My mom ordered their spaghetti dish that came with meatballs (i forget exactly what it was called). We really like good meatballs, but these were not to par. I tried a part of a meatball and immediately tasted what seemed to be hot pepper flakes...inside the meatball. I feel that the prominence of other spices (garlic, parsley, oregano) would have really brought out the goodness of the meatball, but this strong spice seemed to mask any other flavor.

Some good things here, but I think there are other places where you will get more for your money.
author: Emily D.

description:
Don't bother.

 After work 1 day I met up with a girlfriend and we were about to walk from one of my monthly garage spots at the Sheraton to North Beach.

 Cafe Pescatore is right across the street from the Sheraton so we thought heck why not try this joint... I'm always a fan of outdoor tables. Plus it didn't look too touristy at that time.

As we were about to sit down on a table,1 very obnoxious waiter snapped "Oh I need to clean that up first!" My friend and I shot each other a look.
I placed my heavy bag down and was going to take out my ipad to watch 1 of my stores on video. In my hands mind you, I was not using the table.
 The man look at me like he was going to kill me because I used the chair for my bag. We clearly were not in the way.  His mannerisms were such a turn off. He was all huffy and bitchy. I guess he did not realize that we were about to spend money.
F that noise. We promptly walked out.

 There are so many options of places to go in this city especially in the 94133. That chump of a man not only needed to clean up the table but he needed to clean up his act too & step up his game.  Even if he did think that we were tourists, more of a reason to be welcoming. 


Dear management, consider re-training or getting quality staff because without the 'service' in customer service, there will be no customer.

Good luck with that.
author: Athena S.

description: Food was good. Had the Bianca pizza and the flavor was wonderful!  Our waitress Chelsea was great - we had a good size group and she was excellent with all of us!
author: Rachel S.

description:
I don't know where it came from but it's marathon tradition to have pasta dinner before the race. This place was adjacent to our hotel so it was the obvious choice. Since it's close to Fisherman's Wharf, it was also an Italian seafood place and I don't eat much seafood so my menu options were limited. 

It was rush hour and we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. They let us go back to our hotel or room and said they would call us. I thought it was pretty cool that you could either chill in the hotel lobby or your room. You could also put the tab on your hotel bill. Service here is awesome no doubt. 

We got a nice window seat but there was a draft. Luckily our amazing waiter came by and covered the seal that was letting air in. Since every pasta dish had seafood in it, I ordered the margherita pizza. It wasn't anything special and a little too greasy for my taste. I was worried about what the grease would do for my race the next day so I had the waiter recommend a tea to me. He did an excellent job telling us about their selection and we ended up ordering an African red bush. This is a loose leaf tea that came in a tea kettle and we were advised to let it steep and squeeze a few drops of lemon to kill the pizza grease. After a few cups, I was feeling better about the pizza grease I just consumed. 

Overall not a bad place and a great experience but I'm not sure I would dine here again. The food isn't enticing enough.
author: Sukhraj B.

description: I've been coming here for over twenty years the food is always good the service always warm and accommodating. I highly recommend visiting if your in area.
author: Lazaro L.

description: The service and food is the best around. My friend works there and I took my girlfriend out on a date. We where so impressed with the quality of the food and price, this was one of our favorite places to have dinner!!
author: Byron P.

description:
Came here for breakfast before catching the bus to take me to the BART to go to the airport. It was also attached to the hotel I was staying in..... 

I was the only one there and they had already stopped serving breakfast. At 11am on a Sunday.... But there were a couple of things on the menu I was interested in. 

Food was good. Service was average. Not a must eat place in the Wharf, but not a bad pick either.
author: Holly C.

description:
This restaurant is a gem 

For our first annual Company Christmas party, I decided to book a large table at Cafe P for our holiday festivities! What a great idea.

Upon my arrival to the restaurant they had our table all laid out with special holiday touches to make it extra festive. Custom ornament arrangements had been added to our place settings and definitely some special attention to detail was paid to our party (which was HIGHLY noted by myself & my boss)

The service was great! Drinks were yummy and the food was just amazing. Everything came out as ordered for our ENTIRE group! (My family used to own restaurant so I greatly appreciated with orders are completed & executed without any hiccups)

To start, we had the Seafood Antipasti, Bruschetta, sausages and Margarita pizza for appetizers, everything was yummy

Main Courses: Salmon, Steak, Cioppino Special, Chicken Marsala & Chicken Parmasen to name a few. Everything was cooked to the right temperature & finished off with fresh cracked pepper & fresh shaved parmesan 

The vibe was great, the decor of the restaurant is beautiful and suits the space very well and was NOTED by our whole company, the energy and level of noise was not to loud. Overall great restaurant with great food and wonderful service.

All of our employees love the restaurant and gave me several comment on how much they enjoyed everything from the drinks, food to decoration throughout

We have decided to make this our annual traditional and will DEFINITELY be back next year.

Thanks Cafe P :)
author: Eva C.

description:
Dined here tonight,  party of nine.   

Pros:  service was good,  Marlo was on top of it.   Did not write anything down and got orders correct with one exception noted later.   From time of order to time of food coming out was moderately quick.   Most dishes are good.   Sea bass,  polenta,  Apple salad,  crab ravioli,  calamari,  gelato were all very good. Convenient and decent option in the Wharf. 

Cons: halibut was very dry and disappointing,  a third person ordered halibut but got sea bass instead... But she was happy this happened.   Had to get side order of lemon caper butter to make halibut edible.   Capilini carbonara was dry. 

For those that don't know,  this Best Western is a Kimpton hotel and restaurant.
author: Justin M.

description: This place can do no wrong.  Great vibe & plenty of smiling faces at the bar! Food is amazing. Brilliant staff.  Just go!
author: Bobby B.

description: We had lunch here and really liked it. My husband has in his own words "amazing" crab cakes. The focaccia bread they bring to the table is phenomenal. My side salad was a mixture of various greens and great quality. I had the bolognese spaghetti which was amazing. I wish we had eaten here a second time.
author: Leslie S.

description: We visited the peir 39 area and ate at a few restaurants. None of which were that impressive food wise, or had much of an atmosphere. We then decided  to hit happy our at the bar/restaurant next to our hotel. What a great place! Charles and the team made us feel welcome and helped guide us through some great local beers. I have a calamari and it was superb! Fresh and tender with crisp clean batter. Now sat here again on our last day. Thanks for the great food, drink and conversation! Ollie and Rhia from England.
author: Oliver W.

description: We were shocked at the quality of this hotel restaurant. Service was outstanding and would even come back, and this is from a San Francisco resident!
author: michael d.

description: First time eating here, food is beyond amazing, service is spectacular, my favorite restaurant by far. Definitely will make this a stop next time I'm in San Francisco. Love this place
author: Lucy M.

description:
We came here for breakfast.

The restaurant was clean, then nautical decor was nice.  The waiter was polite.

The food was okay, same quality as IHOP or Denny's.  The eggs and potatoes were bland so I added salt and pepper.  I loved the sourdough toast.

Service is very slow.

They used to make amazing potatoes, but I think they got a new cook or something when Best Western took over because they were flavorless and soft as opposed to previously being flavorful and crispy on the outside.
author: Lora P.

description:
well, let me say at the outset that i had checked their menu online and was impressed with their breakfast menu. this menu changes at 10, when it is shortened to abt 6 items. so we got up in plenty of time to arrive early.

damn. we were there on a saturday, and the really varied breakfast menu was only for mondays thru fridays. so we were stuck with th 6 items to choose from.

the coffee was good. the mushroom omelette, sourdough toast and hash browns were very good.  hubby's italian sausage omelette was very good.

the only reason we didn't go back the same day was because of the limited menu.  
and had we known beforehand that it was what it was, we would have gone to ihop instead.
author: Diane C.

description:
We went there for breakfast.  The wife and kids had the eggs and bacon, with a side of French toast.  It was ok, but not worth the price.  I had the crab Benedict.  It was good, but not great.  The place was nice and cozy.

We had a restaurant.com coupon, and they didn't show it on the receipt until I reminded him of it, so as a previous poster noted, check your bill.
author: Stu E.

description:
I went here recently the night before my wife's marathon.  We were tired and very hungry after getting lost several times in the great maze of San Francisco (this is to be expected of course if you're not a local).  I understand that it was a bit later at night and they might have been trying to close up but honestly in the city of san francisco on a saturday night by the wharf, that is no excuse for poor service.  They were slow in taking our order.  They were slow in bringing our order and they almost forgot a simple glass of wine that I ordered.  It was not very crowded save for the cluster of dumb waiters standing around talking to each other in front of the kitchen counter.
I was extremely pissed off at the lack of customer service.  Their attitude towards us was very nonchalant and careless.  

I do not recommend this place to anyone.  Overpriced food that was not very good, and awful service.  Plenty of other restaurants by the wharf to eat at instead.
author: Nolan B.

description: Good atmosphere, my fish was a little too spicy for me but they offered me a new dish in place of it. My mom and boyfriend seemed to like it more than me.
author: Larissa M.

description:
It saddens me that I am actually forced to give this establishment any sort of star. I feel as though contributing any amount of stars is somewhat of a crime against taste buds.  I recently moved to the neighborhood and thought it would make sense to try this seemingly normal looking quiet spot for dinner. We ordered the spaghetti, caesar salad, crab cakes, and clam chowder. I once bleieved that spaghetti was impossible to mess up... I stand corrected. The salad actually had no dressing, and included two anchovies that were the scariest shade of wrinkled purple. The crab cakes weren't cooked and tasted as if they had recently been thawed, and the clam chowder had the consistency of a room remperature glass of water.

Other than that, it was FANTASTIC!!!
author: Cait S.

description:
After dropping a friend off at the cruise port, I spotted a parking place directly in front of Cafe Pescatore and felt that was fate, beckoning me inside. I must always follow my instincts. It was a delightful spot, a little Italian cafe, warm and welcoming. I had a difficult time deciding among the brunch offering and finally settled for the omelet con granchio at $14.95. It was a scrumptious offering filled with crabmeat, asparagus, fontina cheese, scallions and thyme and your choice of toast...I had sourdough. That and a cup of latte were the perfect breakfast for me. 

The lunch and dinner menus looked very appealing with varied selections of salads, pizza, pastas, seafoods and meat choices. Service was good ( it wasn't very crowded that morning )and there was a nice wine selection
author: Carmen H.

description:
Salvation from the underwhelming breakfast at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf which is just about next door to this cafe! Wonderful breakfast menu, great service, much much much better than what's at the Sheraton's mediocre breakfast buffet...

Check out their signature sausage omelettes, crab Benedict or anything else on the menu...

I was so impressed by breakfast, I tried them one evening for dinner. A decent three star dinner. Great service, decent (but not spectacular) food. I enjoyed the crabcake dinner and the panna cotta desert.
author: Tom A.

description:
Included the service, then charged it again. Adds up to 36%!
Error...I don't think so!  Watch your bill AND your bank charges.
This place caters to tourists, and seems to get hotel referrals.
As a local, I would avoid it.
author: Ralph A.

description:
After having a so-so experience @Fiore D'Italia nearby i  was a little reluctant to try 
another Italian restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised by this dining experience. The food was quite good and the waiter was entertaining and attentive without being intrusive. I would definitely eat there again.
author: Francis M.

description:
This was easily one of the worst dinning experiences I've ever had. The fact that I even have to give it a star is upsetting. My fiance and I were visiting SF during the weekend and after a few hours of walking, we were searching for a lunch spot. We, by chance, stumbled by Cafe Pescatore and after reading the menu, we decided that it looked decent enough for a quick lunch. Wow, were we wrong!

First, there was one waiter for all the tables. This place wasn't packed, but, there were certainly a number of tables filled (assuming from the attached hotel?) that required more than 1 waiter. The waiter was clearly stressed running around to all of the tables. It was also very clear that there was serious tension between the kitchen staff and the waiter (we were seated right by the open kitchen, so we heard/saw all the arguments). At this point, I don't blame the waiter for arguing with the kitchen staff for being incompetent, b/c that's what they were.

I ordered a mixed salad expecting a standard mixed salad (nothing too special). Not only was this "salad" pathetic, it cost eight dollars. The salad consisted of: a tiny, tiny plate with MAYBE 1/2 cup of greens, topped with a lot of cheese and a single sliced cherry tomato (almost like it snuck in there without the kitchen staff knowing). They didn't even put the walnuts on it that were on the menu description, and the mediocre dressing was on the side. I was shocked that they were trying to pass this off as a "meal", a lunch mixed salad or not, it was disgusting and the fact that they have the nerve to charge 8 dollars for something so sad is near extortion. 

My fiance got a brunch meal--french toast. How can you mess up french toast? Apparently, you can. It was so soggy the bread was just crumbling apart, excessively sweet (yes, it's french toast, but, this was WAY over the top), and disgusting. He also ordered a side bowl of fruit (for 5 dollars, mind you) that never came. We eventually just cancelled the order. Finally, about 5 minutes before we paid the check, they bring over stale bread.

This place is so pathetic the people who work there even know it--the host (I guess that's what he was?) took %15 off our bill for no other reason than knowing the place sucks (we never complained about anything or mentioned a thing to them, except to cancel the fruit order).

If you're even in SF, never ever go here. It's a gigantic waste of money for food that's so below par it's frightening. There are so many beautiful restaurants near the water (or even in Union square, a very short trip away) that are such a better value.  Avoid at all cost.
author: Emily F.

description: Don't waste your time! Recommend to come here by the hotel we are staying at, that was a mistake. There are too many good places around. Not going to bash the place, just don't waste your time!!
author: Reid E Jensen J.

description:
We just ate lunch at this Cafe. It was about 1:30 when we arrived on a Saturday and we only saw one other patron as were seated. (However more people did arrive). We opted to start with the fresh Bruschetta as that is my husbands most favorite appetizer and it was absolutely delicious. So fresh and flavorful. Husband ordered the sea food fettuccine and he said it was great and that the sea food tasted very fresh. I opted for the steak panini and it was equally fresh and flavorful.

The atmosphere was very welcoming and casual but seems like it would also be perfect for date night. The service was good and we felt we were taken care of!
author: Nicole C.

description:
the green breakfast smoothie was very good. expensive ($8!) but substantial. and i'm going to assume for that price that all the ingredients were organic. let me have that one :) 4 stars for breakfast smoothies!

we also ate there for dinner one night during our stay in SF. and that's why the 2 stars. the host that seated us took one look at our 2 young kids, made no conversation, no smile, but just took us straight to the back of the restaurant where we were certain not to disturb any of the other patrons. :( fine. the bread & olive oil dip was nice. the waiter was friendly & prompt. the food was okay. overpriced IMO for basic italian and seafood dishes. 

i would go back for breakfast but not for dinner or lunch.
author: Eryn H.

description: Good food, especially for a hotel restaurant.  Not a bad choice for dinner or breakfast.
author: Zach H.

description:
You gotta be kidding me! Who can actually make a BAD tasting chicken?! There is NO finesse in the way food is brought to you at this place.
Service was ok for us as we went there later in the night ... 
All in all, I won't go there even if it was free!
author: Shirin E.

description: Ate here for Sunday afternoon lunch.  Large amount of customers and only 1 waitperson....same person was also bar tender.  Needless to say service was poor.  Service not attentive to my being there.  Soup was brought to me and I had to ask for a spoon.  Food was reasonable in taste but I make better at home.  Had pear bread pudding for dessert.  No pear taste at all.  I would not go back again. jmo
author: jerome m.

description:
I would give this place a 2 for service and a 4 for food.. thus a 3.

The waitress came by 3 times: drinks, order, check. Always a sign you'll get a bad tip from me. Not happy with the service, except the guy who poured water was totally on his game and came to our table very often for refills.

To start, the apple salad was very refreshing and tasty. The sweetness was just perfect for a salad.
Basil pesto pizza was very very good and I liked the way it's served on the wood plank still warm.

My friends got the crab ravioli and they said it was just okay. My other friend got the crab cakes and we were a little shocked at the teensy amount of food she was given for the price.

I have been here before (a year ago) and was slightly more impressed then, which is why I decided to come back. This year, I can say that I might only ever come back for the pizza!
author: Amanda N.

description:
Great ambience for a slow Sat morning.   Nice indie Mumford and Sons type music, interesting setting for people watching and great coffee.   Low pressure, pleasant service.  Had the Cinnamon Raisin French toast - very good.  

People next to me returned three dishes - not hot enough - and their dishes were brought back quickly, apologetically, and followed up by a visit from the manager and the Chef!   Classy quick turnaround. 

Recommended as a not so hidden gem.
author: Dennis C.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. The food was good and better than most in Fisherman's Wharf area but not at that next level. And with so many tourists I guess they are not worried about repeat customers. It is too bad since we live close by and are in the City a lot. Two of us had this dinner and shared tastes. The Apple Salad was fresh but it had a minimal amount of apples (just sliced thinly on the side) and there were only a few small walnut pieces in proportion to the salad size. The Cesar Salad fared better in composition and again was fresh. The Mussels (and side of Fries) were delicious and had a unique mildly spicy tomato base. The Spaghetti Bolognese was served too hot and was very bland and uninspired, even though it looked as though the cooks had put some effort into its making. For dessert Biscotti and Raspberry Sorbet were good. 

We might try this restaurant again.
author: Stein H.

description: Nice restaurant, great ambience in the evening. The food was good, I wouldn't say it was amazing, but delicious. The marinara sauce tasted a little generic, in my opinion. The bread was pretty tasty. I can't remember the name of the dish I had, it was angel hair pasta, tomato, basil, garlic and evoo. It was good, but there was so much garlic that it really over powered the dish. I would definitely go back, just to give it another shot, I think it would be worth it.
author: Nicole M.

description: My iPhone auto corrects Pescatore to "pet store" which sums up the food quality we dined on; canned, processed and lacking creativity or true flavor. You can tell that this restaurant exists solely due to the business that the attached hotel feeds it. Very overpriced as well. Service was ok, but it's bad when the highlight of a restaurant is the bread.
author: Karen M.

description: Amidst the old, cheesy wharf choices and chain restaurants, this was a solid choice. Caprese salad and crab cakes were both spot on. Might have to come here one more time before I depart.
author: Katie P.

description: The food was delicious but the service wasn't that great. I went with a party of 9 people and everyone thought the food was delicious. I enjoyed the bread and olive oil brought out when we sat down.
author: Noa R.

description:
Went to cafe pescatore this past saturday with my wife and mother in law. We had out 2 dogs with us so we asked a waiter outside if we could sit outside with the dogs and he said yes, he'll be with me in a moment. I let my wife and mother sit outside while i waited at the front of the restaurant for about 20 mins. No one came to me, there was no host and the waiter i talked to earlier would not even look in my direction. I went and grabbed menu's on my own. Waited another 15-20 minutes at the table and still nothing. My wife went in to ask a manager for service. Finally a manager came out to take our order. We got our drinks in about 10 minutes, however after another 45 minutes, no food. All we ordered were 2 appetizers and a soup. There were a few tables occupied inside and 2-3 occupied outside, hardly a lunch rush so not sure why we were so neglected. After about 50 minutes, the waiter finally came and asked how we were. At that point, why bother, he hadn't so much as said hi in close to an hour! So we waited about about hour an half in total and still no food. I asked the manager to check us out as we could not wait anymore. She was nice enough to comp the 3 drinks we had, however not enough for us to ever consider this place again. The waiter acted like such a jackass, and had such an attitude problem that no comp would ever make up for such a bad experience. My mother in law is in town visiting so wasting an hour an half on nothing just sucks. Luckily there was a Trader Joe's close by and we picked up food to go home. Cafe Pescatore = Never again!

The manager was nice though. Can't knock her for the horrible experience. I think the owner and the overwhelmed/not competent waiter are to blame. I worked in the food service industry and would have been fired for giving any client such an experience. What a shame.
author: Aryan A.

description: Average. Service was adequate. I had the Proscuitto & red pepper panini which was suprising too bland. My husband had the Margarita pizza which was ok. Pretty interior.but would probably not return.
author: Lisa K.

description:
We came here on a busy Saturday, were greeted right away and seated at the bar until a table opened up. +1 star for great wine recommendations and tasty cocktails.

I'm vegan and this is a seafood restaurant, so +1 star for handling that with grace and not making me feel like an imposition instead of a customer. Many waiters are flummoxed by this, but he gave a couple of recommendations about how to tweak their vegetarian dishes to be vegan. I ended up with a bruschetta appetizer, which was AWESOME, a pizza that had a lovely, crisp, flavorful crust, and fantastic lime sorbet for dessert. My partner had a shrimp appetizer he adored, a halibut entree that had him rolling his eyes in ecstasy, and a marsala cream parfait - another recommendation from our awesome waiter - for dessert. +1 for awesome, awesome food. I found the portions and prices to be very reasonable, especially for the quality.

They offer your choice of flat, sparkling, or tap water (we just had tap) and bring a container to the table, so we were never waiting for refills. Service was genuinely friendly and perfectly timed - I hate when servers rush a meal. I overheard our server switch to Spanish for a neighboring table like it was no big deal. +1 for great service.

The place is smallish but lovely, and I love watching the kitchen staff work. It was a little on the cramped side, with a very small table, and there was a bit of noise, but I still though it was cozy rather than uncomfortable, so I'm star-neutral on ambience.

As we were leaving, we mentioned we had parked in the nearby Safeway parking garage. Turns out, they validate for free parking through the month of June. Sweet! +1 star for free parking in SF, because seriously, nobody does that.
author: Muse N.

description:
Not a bad place.  Actually, pretty damn good.  My three year old is a very picky eater and I knew she wouldn't eat much of her food and the best chance for her to even eat some of it was to make it as bland as possible.  So with that in mind, I decided to just order the Venticelli noodles with a little butter and shredded Parmesan on the side.  (Don['t worry, I get her veggies and Fruits in her somehow.  Its called squeezies and they are a godsend.)  Anyhow, she ate two bites of her food and decided she had a stomachache (bread should never be put on the table in from of a three year old or myself!) So, I finished her dish having decded not to order my own  and to just share my fiance's fetticine with clams and her choice.  I must say, it was the best pasta I have eaten in years and years and it didn't even have any special sauce or pairings!  I was shocked at how incredible pasta with a little butter and some cheese on top could taste.  I also adored my fiance's fetticine with clams and thought that I was in heaven for a moment when after eating the main dish, I was treated to the one of the most delicious desserts Id had in North Beach.  With all of the Tiramisus and other Italian delicasies in the vicinity, that is a lot to say.  I was really impressed with this little place and while there for dinner, we saw that they serve breakfast in the mornings.  We decided to try it again to find out whether this was jsut a lucky hit or if the breakfast would uphold my opinion.  I was very impressed once again!  I had the most delicious eggs (fluffy) and a green smoothie that they had advertised as their special.  Even with the Fishermans Wharf area being crappy, I would go back to Pescatore again and again.  I highly recommend it!  
.
author: Jill S.

description: Looking for a place to have breakfast before our duck tour and we decided on Pestatore.  Breakfast portions was more then plenty.  I very much appreciated since I opted for the $17.00 mimosas.  BUT BEWARE!!!!  they added a 19% gratuity for a party of 5 and a $5.00 SF mandatory charge.   What the heck???  I know I was drinking bottomless mimosas but I can still read my bill.  When we questioned the  waiter he said $5.00 was due to Obama...?? Then he took the bill back and brought a new bill with the gratuity off an the "SF Mandatory" removed.   I guess no longer mandatory.
author: Summer M.

description: Don't let the "cafe" fool you. A very elegant place, full bar and distinct menu. Bartender Steve has saved us from the cold winds on more than one occasion.
author: Anne S.

description:
Absolutely awful! We are so disappointed that we wasted a meal in San Francisco at this restaurant. The service was slow and the waitress was very rude. She did not apologize but instead laughed when we reminded her that one of the drinks that was ordered well before the appetizers (which we had already finished) had still not arrived. She did not ask if we wanted another round of drinks or how our meals were. My sister's pasta was over cooked. The crab ravioli was so incredibly salty that it was nearly inedible. When we finally waved down a waiter to let him know how bad it was he gave us $3 off the $23 meal. He said they tasted it and agreed that it was on the salty side (which a rediculous understatement) but said we should have told someone earlier. We had already all tasted it which basically consumed half of the extremely small portion size. Out of the the 7 meals and two appetizers that were ordered by our party, we could say the one appetizer (the calamari) was the only good dish. 
There were no kids meals available, which is odd since it is attached to the Tuscan Hotel. 

To sum it up.. Bad service and even worse food!

This is no reflection on the Tuscan Hotel which we have stayed at on numerous occasions and is a wonderful hotel with great service.
author: Paula B.

description:
A major fall for a once-charming restaurant.

My midwestern parents, when visiting SF, love to stay at the Tuscan, the hotel that houses the Pescatore, and thankfully the hotel is still a lovely alternative to the dreary, enormous hotels in the area. While the 'rents always enjoy trying new types of food around town, having the Pescatore in house as a comfortable Italian option is convenient, and one of the best things about staying there. The food was always good, the service friendly, and the atmosphere cozy and warm. 

But it's been over three years since my parents had come to town, and our experience last week shows that something terrible has happened to Pescatore in the mean time. On our most recent visit on a Tuesday night, very little went well. Even from the start, something about the room seemed off, with too many lights, and a giant cloth screen separating a back area, as if the place was under construction. The manager was that overly-friendly type that trips over into creepy, all wide eyed and slow-talking, like he was just barely covering up a seething rage. 

When our waitress finally arrived, we ordered a mixed seafood antipasti, and we were ready to order main courses but our waitress interrupted and said she'd get that appetizer order in and come back for our main course orders.

A busboy delivered the antipasti, a small, blazing hot skillet of a handful of mussels and exactly two shrimp. The shells of the mussels were, of course, so hot they were impossible to handle, and both me and my father burned our hands.

Our waitress never came back.

Finally we flagged her down, and I said, "excuse me, we'd like to order our main courses?" And what do you think she did, apologize? No! "Well, I was waiting for you guys," she said, angrily. We were dumbfounded. Waiting for us to do what, exactly?

Main courses,when they got there, were sad. The sea bass came in a "saffron cream sauce" that looked like congealed yellow pudding. Not even that good. More like yellow glue paste. Cod was dull and flavorless. Prawns and polenta were fine but probably cost about 30 cents to make.

My dessert was advertised as some sort of apple tart, but it was a frozen toaster strudel, I swear to god, with the little packet of drizzly frosting? Yuck.

On a side note, my parents went there for breakfast without me another day, and had a similarly poor experience. The restaurant advertises new menu items on a card in the hotel rooms, but when my parents asked about them, they said "No, those are only available for room service." Which a) is stupid, and b) was not indicated anywhere on the card in the room. They also managed to ignore a request for "no cheese" in an omelet.

Pescatore was never going to win any awards, but it was reliable and nice. Now it's embarrassing and sad. And hey, Tuscan Inn, you guys should know my parents are much less likely to want to stay there next time, as the bad restaurant experiences really colored their stay. Just FYI.
author: Ben G.

description: I stayed in the hotel connected to the restaurant so it was just a little walk to dinner. The hostess is very welcoming and they have quite a lot of staff. The service was pretty fast, and the food overall was excellent. I would come here again, even if the atmosphere is particularly loud.
author: Katia P.

description: Great service and good food.  The bruschetta and prime rib panini were delicious.
author: Bill H.

description: This the worst restaurant nightmare I've ever encountered, the kind of thing you only see on TV like Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmare. Waited 40 mins for a table, then another 15 minutes for the server to come back from smoking break, then another 45 minutes for food to come.  We specifically asked for NO BACON, we don't eat meat. After halfway through our meal, guess what's in the white bean ragout, yes, freagin bacon bits!!! Also, for $28 Mahi Mahi, it was over cooked, like torched. And what Italian restaurant runs out of meatballs (for our kid)??? Server never came back to check on us, never refilled water, everyone was gone and didn't care if any customer was still in the restaurant. We came in at 9pm on a Friday night, left at 11pm. Manager comp the whole meal but more upsetting was the bacon in the white bean ragout....such a waste of time, no regard to customers..will NEVER come back here again. This place should be called PISS-CATORE!
author: Lissa H.

description:
Very pleasantly surprised. I was alittle frightened by the so-so reviews I read,  but I can honestly say we enjoyed our lunch. The bread and olive oil were very good and my green smoothie was great. (Pricey though). We both had the tomato polenta soup which was very tasty. I had the veggie panini and throughly enjoyed it. My hubby had the chicken parm (which they let him order as a panini) and really liked it.

The server was very nice-he didnt seem frazzled even though it appeared he was working by himself.

All in all a very good meal. :)
author: Kerri B.

description: We live 25 miles away, but played tourist for a birthday weekend in SF.  Choose Pescatore for the outdoor seating, after wandering the busier streets in the wharf.  It was getting late on a Friday night and we were hungry.  It started with a warm greeting, including welcoming our chihuahua and got better from there.  The blackened tuna was yummy; the pizza blew us away!  The staff was so friendly, a few folks from inside came out to say Hi to the pup and give her treats.  A group sitting near us were playing yakzee, laughing and having fun.  A relaxing and personal vibe -- not what I expected considering its location.  A great choice -- thanks!
author: A.M. D.

description: What a pleasant surprise.  We got to the hotel (yes it's in the Best Western Plus) early evening after a couple of days in Napa. Too lazy to go through the whole reservation/taxi thing so we thought we'd give it a try.  Atmosphere was comfortable, nice bar and very good service.  Started with the seafood antipasti.  Very fresh, flavorful, garlicky but not overpowering.  Liquid was delicious dipping sauce for the bread.  I had the special - squid-ink linguine with clams and mussels.  Pasta was homemade, seafood was fresh and sauce was perfectly balanced.  My wife had the capellini pomodoro - bright flavor and obviously fresh ingredients.   I would definitely dine here again, even if I wasn't staying at the hotel.
author: Dave K.

description:
I met my sister and her family her the other night for dinner. She had a restaurant.com coupon for the meal, or I would probably have declined the invitation based upon their online menu, prices, and yelp reviews but since the meal was going to be discounted and I wanted to spend a little more time with family, I accepted. 

I ordered an Arnold Palmer and that was the best part of the meal aside from being able to spend some time with family. I didn't like the fact that they only refilled the iced tea portion of my drink and not the lemonaid. My sister ordered calamari and cheese stick appetizers. The calamari was pretty good and not overcooked, but I was not impressed with the cheese sticks even though they were primarily ordered for the kids. The free bread that they brought out was quite good, especially with the olive oil and balsamic.

For my entree, I thought the Fusilli Mediterranean sounded good. The marinara sauce was okay, but nothing special and the seared chicken breast was actually a few chunks of way overcooked and tasteless chicken. Two of the others ordered the ravioli con granchio. They got about 7 raviolis which weren't very impressive. The best choice was the prawns with polenta which came with 4 very large prawns in a nice presentation. 

After the meal, I excused myself to go to the restroom and found that it was a long walk through the hotel that the restaurant is attached to. I had asked one of the servers at the restaurant where it was and it would seem to me that they should have told me at that point that it was being remodeled and it was necessary to pick up a room key from the front desk to use the restroom in one of the hotel rooms. I didn't however find this out until I had walked all the way through the hotel and then had to go back to the front desk. 

Finally it should be noted that they add a 19% gratuity to the check for parties of 5 or more which I would have no problem with if the service had not been so lackluster. So needless to say, there are so many good restaurants in San Francisco that would be highly unlikely that I would ever eat here again.
author: Debi T.

description:
About four blocks from pier 39 so I guess they are pretty tired of the tourists, at least that is how they acted for my family.  In their defense we did not make a reservation but the place was nearly empty when we arrived. 

Seated outside, I guess the other tables were indeed reserved; no problem there. Everything went downhill from there. No one wanted to serve as evidenced be the argument between two servers as to who was responsible for our table. 

To bad the food did not make up for that unprofessional behavior...just warmed -over crap. 

A truely beautiful resturant in a great location. We will not ever return unless we see an entirely different staff.
author: M P.

description: I came on a Wednesday night for dinner which seemed to be a slow night as the restaurant was only half full at 7:30 pm. I sat at the bar and ordered a red wine which was fine. I then ordered the chicken parm for my meal. Although I love Italian food and my coworker raved about this place, I didn't enjoy this meal. The pasta was way al dente for my taste and the chicken was lightly breaded but soggy, all for $24.00 which I think is overpriced. The sauce seemed watered down, too. Not sure if they were going for a light sauce or they were rationing it. Perhaps it was a bad night for the cook or I picked the wrong entree. In either case, at this price point, I would expect quality and consistency. I actually prefer Olive Gardens chicken parm and they include free breadsticks and salad for $16.95. I'm willing to give restaurants a second chance, but it might be awhile before I return to this place.
author: David S.

description:
Cafe Pescatore is the house restaurant for the Best Western Tuscan Inn (a Kimpton property), so if you stay there, this is where your room service food comes from.  The food is generally very good, and service is usually good, but it can suffer if, for example, a large group arrives with no reservation. It's a tourist zone, so things like that happen.  Also, if the hotel is full, it can be crowded--especially at the bar--at peak times.

They do a nice cioppino, and they now make it with the local Dungeness crab.

The ribeye steak is wonderful, as is the spaghetti Bolognese. The Caesar salad is small, but the dressing is great and they have anchovies on request.  If you fancy pizza, keep in mind that on request they can make it with whatever ingredients they have on hand, so if you don't like the two or three house specials, ask what else is available.

The wine list has a decent selection of California and Italian wines.
author: Charlie G.

description: The food was ok but not exceptional.  I would recommend anywhere in North Beach up the street and you would get a better meal. The service was ok, but the policies on substitutions was rigid. I've actually never experienced anything like it. Even minor requests were met with concerns. We wanted penne not spaghetti and the waiter had to ask because the "kitchen doesn't like substitutions". We wanted a different sauce on the ravioli and he had to ask about that, "but couldn't make any promises". He charged me for a small amount of extra sauce which I needed because the raviolis were so dry. I would not recommend the pomodoro sauce as it was not a sauce but just some bland chopped tomatoes. The tomatoes soup was very good and so was the tiramisu, but they took a long time making the coffee and it came a good 10 min after the dessert. Overall this was the worst meal I had in San Francisco. I would not go again.
author: Dorothy H.

description: We started with the bruschetta - yum! Depending on how hungry you are, primi dishes are a bit smaller in portion whereas the secondi are heftier. Under the primi, the crab ravioli is amazing and very filling. I would recommend the crab cioppino under the secondi menu. To finish, you have to have the warm chocolate cake. Don't be deceived by the small size when it comes out - it's very dense and can satisfy the sweet tooth of two.
author: Eman K.

description: No bottomless mimosas as still advertised on their website and if you want a mimosa, small one will cost $10
author: BellyUp D.

description:
Was sent here by the concierge at Argonaut Hotel (great hotel by the way).  Overall I give it two stars because for this town you can really do much better for a seafood/italian meal.  If you do come I think you'll still be fairly happy though.

Okay, I came because I needed a place to eat dinner that allowed dogs and was good for kids as well and was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.  This place met all those requirements and so away we went.

With the dog we were able to sit on the patio and they were very accommodating which was very nice on their part.  Actually the service here was actually very nice; however, the food really let us down.

I've been to several restaurants in San Francisco over the years and have had some great meals there and was hoping for another one.

We started with the bruschetta appetizer which actually was decent.  The fresh shaved cheese on top was probably the best part.  The tomatoes were also good; however, I felt the bread let the dish down.  It was coated in what seemed like a pesto flavoring that I didn't think added to the dish.  I felt the free bread was actually better, ha.

For main courses my wife ordered the shrimp dish which also had polenta.  The shrimp were MASSIVE on the dish and five were included.  It had a tomato sauce with it that went well with the shrimp and the polenta.  Overall it was a decent dish.  I ordered the crab ravioli.  It came with about seven crab filled ravioli in a very, very watery sauce.  I was very surprised at how runny/watery the sauce was and it seemed to have very little flavoring at all.  The ravioli itself was good, maybe slightly undercooked, but the crab filling was tasty.

We normally would order desert at a place like this; however, given the fact we weren't that excited by the overall food we decided to skip that and simply go for some ice cream.

Overall, you will probably be happy going here; however, if you are looking for a meal you will remember while in San Francisco you have some much better options.
author: Kyle M.

description: Definitely not impressed.  Wait staff was okay.   I felt their food was overpriced.  While my caesar salad was acceptable, the crab cakes were incredibly dense and bland.  There was no crab flavor, the accompanying sauce was also lacking.  My friend's shrimp cocktail was very pricy for for small prawns.  While I really liked the decor (the nautical theme was nice without being overbearing), the 80' s hair band music did not mesh well.
author: Lynnette M.

description: I live in the neighborhood, and I was looking to not walk far tonight with the weather.  Pescatore was the closest open restaurant to home, so I went.  To a person, the service was lovely, and I would go back on that basis.  It is just nice to be in any restaurant where it is clear that people care about what they are doing.  Also, the wine list is surprisingly interesting for a hotel restaurant.  I will also go back for a glass at the bar.  Unfortunately, the food didn't live up to everything else.  Each dish was edible, but the crab in my cioppino was scant and bland.  The prawns and fish were way over-cooked.  The broth was decent but could have been better, and there were huge, unpleasant chunks of garlic at the bottom of the bowl.  I will go back to this restaurant for the service and wine, and I will happily give them another chance for food, too.  There were too many positives so close to home to keep me away.  Honestly, the food flaws are pretty easily fixed (salt the water you boil the crab in for a start), and I hope for better next time.  Not bad at all, but not great.
author: Lisa R.

description: Good for breakfast. Had the crab benedict. Prices are reasonable. Short walk from our hotel and the pier
author: Jason L.

description: Terrible.  Everything tasted supper fried in crappy old oil.  Crab cakes, which should be a no brainer, tasted like oily nasty.
author: Andrew M.

description:
After reading some of the other Yelp reviews, I wasn't expecting much... but it was close to where we were all going and my friend had a restaurant coupon so we gave it a go.

We were pleasantly surprised.

Food - good.  Appetizers: Bruschetta & Calamari were both very good.  Entree: I had the crab ravioli which was also good.  

Service - excellent. We had a very nice, very attentive waiter.  

Atmosphere - it's actually a cute little restaurant.  simply decorated, outdoor seating (if there's ever a warm enough evening in San Francisco), and the bar looked to be fairly nice as well.

Overall, it was a good meal.  I wouldn't necessarily go way out of my way to go here, but if you're in the area and don't want to head up to an Italian restaurant in North Beach,then this is a good choice.
author: Nedra D.

description: Food was pleasant. Portions suck! My husband ordered the spaghetti after four bites he realized it was gone.
author: Michelle E.

description: The spaghetti was fantastic in both the chicken parmesan and the spaghetti bolognese. The Margherita pizza was outstanding and the meal wasn't obsurdly priced.
author: Micheal W.

description: Delicious food and awesome service. Chelsea was the bomb, very attentive to detail and service! Highly recommend!
author: El S.

description: Delicious food and drinks, always a little empty for some reason! Brunch was decent but I wish their happy hour was longer!
author: Amber M.

description: My husband and I were looking for a dinner spot that wasn't to far from the hotel. We happen to see the menu and saw a few items that we would order in a heartbeat. I decided on the spaghetti with meatballs and my husband had the fettuccini with seafood. The portions were big, but the food was so good we barely left anything. The services was also on point.
author: Celi R.

description:
This place was good, not great, but good; I can see why it is labelled a tourist trap. My wife and I ate here after a late arrival at the adjoining hotel, it was convenient and certainly did the trick after a few hours of driving.

The menu is a standard American-Italian restaurant menu. Fairly limited and for the most part unimaginative. There were a couple of interesting items, like the Dungeness crab ravioli. My wife ordered those and they were good. I had the Margherita Pizza. This was a bit of a disappointment in the fact that it was just a standard New York style cheese pizza with some basil on top. While it tasted good, it was NOT a Neapolitan pizza as the name would lead you to believe.

What did certainly shine was the dessert. The Pear Bread Pudding was awesome. Definitely try it, you will be pleased.

Honestly, I would not return here, due to the fact that I know there are far better restaurants in North Beach. That being said, it's a perfectly convenient location if you're staying in one of the surrounding hotels and need a bite to eat.
author: Ryan C.

description: Very pedestrian restaurant that is overpriced (a tourist trap). The food was very mediocre for the price, and it took very long to reach our table. The server was quite rude and condescending. They also did not honor my passport discount card on a minor technicality. I would not recommend this restaurant.
author: Raffi K.

description: I'd give this 3.5 stars for my first visit.  Very cute setting/atmosphere but the little round tables and seating area are a bit crowded to get settled in.  The staff was friendly and the crab cake appetizer was really nice and fresh tasting.  We also tried two pizzas...I had the pesto pizza which was fabulous.  My friend had the margerita pizza which really was more like just a cheese pizza with a bit of basil slices on it, wasn't very impressed with that one.  I live in the neighborhood and will try this place again.
author: Janelle C.

description: The Bianca was delicious and was the truffle! The staff was excellent!
author: Luc S.

description: The food was excellent and the service outstanding.  Our waiter Marlo was engaging and entertaining.  The linguine con vongole was tasty and full of clams, my companion had the salmon which she enjoyed.  The fried risotto balls were good but should have 4 rather than 3 to share. Highly recommend.
author: DANIEL A.

description: Staff super friendly... Allowed me to dine with my pup and brought her water. Overall great food and service and two thumbs up!!
author: Maria R.

description: We had a delish dinner. The moist thick pieces of focaccia they serve melt in your mouth. We highly recommend the seafood pasta w/ marinara, the crab ravioli, the roasted tomato soup w/ polenta and shaved parm and the Verdi pizza! Great ambiance also. Great service as well.
author: Julie C.

description: just had a lovely dinner with my sister and b-inlaw.... the halibut was good, the martini was better. I'm a 20 year  local and i approve!!! this place is much better then the food snobs claim it to be... ps/  pardon the typing, but i had more then one martini :)
author: Steve B.

description: The food presentation was great and the taste is fine. To access the restrooms, you have to navigate though the adjacent Best Western Hotel's lobby and walk down a hallway before reaching it. The restaurant's staff were nice and friendly. oh, the menu was presented on a wooden clip board...
author: Lior G.

description: Ate here a few times for a conference at the hotel. food was consistently tasty. homemade soups, etc were good
author: Jeff G.

description:
I really enjoyed my lunch today at Cafe Pescatore. I completely understand how it may be a tourist trap (I go to school IN this tourist trap!), but I was pleasantly surprised. 

Three of us had lunch there today, as an end of the semester thank-you. The prices, for lunch at least, are very reasonable and you get more, higher quality food than you do many places (especially those on the Pier). We had the veggie panini, chicken salad, and penne pasta. All three of us were very satisfied, and impressed, even. The dishes were flavorful and filling. They have an all-day happy hour on Mondays (though we didn't drink), with $3 glasses of wine. That's great! And, on the weekends, they waive the corkage fee, which is also awesome. The service was great--not too pushy, but kept the water glasses filled, and the food came really quick--great for a quick, sit-down lunch. 

I don't know, I have to say I would recommend this as a lunch spot to my colleagues... and might just head back myself! It was a pleasant surprise in the Wharf, and if you are unfortunate enough to have to work/go to school down there, you might try this place instead of another Boudin's sandwich.
author: Bridgette A.

description:
We stayed at the Hyatt on North Point St, and after endless meals on Fisherman's Wharf, we decided we wanted to try something a bit less touristy. I broke out the Urbanspoon app on my iPhone, did some searching, and found Cafe Pescatore, a local Italian, ummm, "favorite" that got good reviews from both the Urbanspoon and Yelp communities. I am sorry to say I disagree with folks in both camps. 

If first impressions are everything, then this place got a big black mark in the first five minutes we were there. After being told there would be a 15 minute wait, we were shuffled over to the bar to wait. Our kids were seated at a small table in the bar area, and although they were well-dressed and were behaving surprisingly well, I got the distinct impression they were not entirely welcome. After a couple of minutes at the bar, we were all asked to move again to the lobby of the adjoining hotel to wait until our name was called. I never mind waiting for a table, especially if the food is good, but a restaurant should at least have a place for people to wait. It struck me as disorganized, and I am not a fan of disorganization. 

As for the food, it wasn't terrible, but it was far from good, and not even in the same universe as inspiring. My wife and I both ordered the Fettucine con Gamberetti (per the menu: fresh spinach fettuccine, tiger prawns, roasted garlic, sundried tomatoes, basil, served with a parmesan cream sauce). Sounds good, right? Ha. It was a thick mass of "if this is fresh, pigs will fly out of my ass" pasta served under a pasty cream sauce with "frozen shrimp that we'll pass off as tiger prawns". I'll give them the roasted garlic. It was good.  But you can only eat so many cloves of garlic before you start peeling paint with your breath.  Our son ordered a bowl of clam chowder (a San Fran staple) that was on par with what you could order on the wharf for half the price.

What pushed this place up from one stars to two was the ambiance. If you focus on the inviting sidewalk patio, white table cloths, classic tiled floors, and dark wood paneling, and ignore the snotty service and the half-ass food, you might be able to trick yourself into thinking you're eating a good meal.
author: Gavin S.

description: Try the Dungeness Crab Ravioli. DELICIOUS. The homemade Foccacia and the service make the meal divine.
author: Aimee G.

description:
My parents stayed at a hotel near Cafe Pescatore for Fathers Day weekend and since we hadn't made reservations anywhere, decided to go to a spot that flew "under the radar." 

The location is great and they have a lovely seating area that opens up outside, bringing in a beautiful breeze on a hot day. The servers were all very friendly and accommodating. The decor was cute with lots of model ships and a large open kitchen. 

The food however was just average. Honestly nothing to write home about or really even to recommend. I had the eggs benedict which was a little on the dry side. I tried the cinnamon french toast as well and it didn't seem like they soaked it enough in batter, again being too dry.

This place is good in a pinch but a pinch from good.
author: Julia N.

description: I have been here a few times. The service is always phenomenal but the food can be hit or miss, depending on what you order. I have taken a couple of chances on items that sounded interesting and have not loved it, but all in all, Cafe Pescatore is good!
author: Kate V.

description: Slow wait staff at first but very pleasant. They got more attentive as meal progressed.  Food was very good. banana pancakes were best ever. veggie frit at a was good. pains were delicious.  overall a very good experience.
author: Keven S.

description:
We went several times since Safeway was giving out "buy one entree get one free" coupons for a while and we had tons of them.  The first time we went was great, I got a panini and my boyfriend had the truffle pizza and they had great coffee, but everytime after that things have slowly deteriorated.  Certainly never go for breakfast.

The ambiance is a mix of French sidewalk cafe and antique Yacht club (an odd combo truly...but still nice inside)  Anyway, I wanted this place to be good and deserve more business but they really don't.
author: rhiannon g.

description: We had breakfast here while staying at the adjacent Tuscan Inn.  I had an omelette, my wife had scrambled eggs.  (My wife would have appreciated a lighter option rather than the whole offering, as she wanted just one egg with toast.)  Food was good and service was good as well.  Nothing outstanding but nothing disappointing, either, which is about par for a hotel restaurant.  Three stars = A-OK.
author: R B.

description: We ate at Pescatore twice during our week long stay in San Francisco.  As you can tell by the name, there's a lot of seafood on the menu, but some nice non-seafood items if you're not a huge fish fan.  I had the bolognese twice--it was that good!  My husband got the fettuccine alfredo the first time and the NY strip the second time, both were tasty.  They had a great wine list with a lot of choices, and our waiter was able to recommend one that paired well with our food (and not the most expensive bottle either!).  Marlo, our waiter, was sassy but friendly and helpful.  It was very close to our hotel, the Sheraton, and was a great way to casually end a busy day of sight-seeing.  I would definitely come back.
author: Keely D.

description: all the crew is great, and the food magnifique Sergio is a good Supervisor and Eddy make great Palomas
author: carlos c.

description: This restaurant was in walking distance to our hotel. The food was good, but quite ordinary considering the prices. So many better options, all in walking distance.
author: Digital A.

description: Nice restaurant, small and intimate. Service was ok, although our server was very obnoxious and informal - probably comparable to a fast food place level. Food was way overpriced. Our desserts saved the night. Restaurant was busy and only 2 servers and no hostess. The manager was just standing behind the bar without helping out at all which was very frustrating to watch. Overall a solid 3 stars but don't fall for the restaurant look... Food was not impressive at all!
author: Melissa H.

description: I dined here with my husband, two children and brother-in-law. This restaurant is attached to the Best Western at Fisherman's Wharf, it is conveniently located to where we were staying (not the BW) for dinner. Our appetizers were delicious: we had calamari and the bruschetta which was really good and garlicky! Our server was really attentive and provided top-notch service. So for this, they get a 4 star. The entrees were just "meh". I had a sea bass in a saffron sauce that had way too much thickening agent. If I were to go again I would have wine and that bruschetta which is totally worth going for.
author: Sharon R.

description: After a long day walking around town nothing sounded better than a hearty Italian meal. This place certainly delivered!  Best crab cakes I've ever had and the pasta was top notch!
author: Jarred E.

description:
